Description: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO FOOD AND BEVERAGE (F&B) MANUFACTURING FACILITIES TO ASSESS AND REDUCE THEIR WATER AND ENERGY USE AND TOXICS USE.  TASKS INCLUDE INDUSTRY ROUNDTABLES, CONDUCTING ASSESSMENTS, SHARING BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, AND PREPARING AND DELIVERING TRAINING MODULES AND FOLLOWING UP WITH PARTICIPATING BUSINESSES TO MEASURE IMPLEMENTATION AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESULTS.   THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $158,612.  SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $187,213.  SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT A GROWING NETWORK OF ORGANIZATIONS DEDICATED TO CLIMATE ACTION AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE WHO PARTNERED TO WORK WITH NEVADA BUSINESSES, MANUFACTURERS AND BIPOC COMMUNITIES TO IMPROVE P2 BEST PRACTICES AND PROVIDE GREEN CERTIFICATION. THE PROJECT WOULD RESULT IN BETTER PROTECTION FOR WORKERS IN INDUSTRIAL FACILITIES AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS (OFTENTIMES BIPOC) WHO LIVE NEAR COMPANIES THAT USE MORE DANGEROUS CHEMICALS TODAY.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $289,271. PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 10/1/2022. REFER TO TERMS AND CONDITIONS.ACTIVITIES:THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES INVOLVE WORKING WITH CHEMICAL MANUFACTURERS OF SAFER PRODUCTS THAT ARE WIDELY USED INDUSTRIALLY IN PLACE OF TOXIC AND HIGH VOC CONTENT SOLVENTS AND SOLVENT FORMULATIONS. THE CONSULTANT AND FORMULATORS WILL WORK WITH SAFER CHOICE TO DETERMINE IF THE SAFER PRODUCTS IN UP TO 10 DIFFERENT CATEGORIES OR APPLICATIONS CAN BE GRANTED A LABEL. IT WILL INCLUDE FINDING COMPANIES IN NEVADA AND REGION 9 THAT HAVE CONVERTED TO THE ALTERNATIVES IN CASES WHERE THE ALTERNATIVES HAVE BEEN USED FOR A NUMBER OF YEARS AND TESTING THE EMERGING SAFER ALTERNATIVES IN CASES WHERE THEY ARE NEWLY DEVELOPED. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE FINDING SAFER INGREDIENTS FOR SOME OF THE PRODUCTS AND REFORMULATING THEM IN CERTAIN CASES. IT WILL INCLUDE WORKING WITH USERS OF THE SAFER PRODUCTS WHO HAVE BEEN USING THE PRODUCTS FOR YEARS AND FOR NEW PRODUCTS OR NEWLY REFORMULATED PRODUCTS, THEY WILL FIND COMPANIES TO TEST THEM AND WILL ASSIST THEM IN CONVERTING TO THE ALTERNATIVES. CASE STUDIES, DETAILING THE COST OF THE ALTERNATIVES, WILL BE DEVELOPED FOR THE SAFER PRODUCTS. THEY WILL ALSO WORK WITH SMALL TO MEDIUM BUSINESSES THAT ARE IN LATINX, TRIBAL AND LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES TO BECOME GREEN CERTIFIED TO MINIMIZE THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT ON THEIR COMMUNITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:GRANT RECIPIENT EXPECTS TO CERTIFY AT LEAST 60 BUSINESSES INCLUDING LATINX, TRIBAL, RURAL COMMUNITIES, AND OTHER SMALL-TO-MEDIUM SIZED BUSINESSES TRAINED IN P2 PRACTICES INCLUDING ENERGY AND WATER SAVINGS, WASTE REDUCTION AND TRANSPORTATION. DELIVERABLES ALSO INCLUDE IDENTIFYING LOW-VOC, LOW TOXICITY ALTERNATIVES TO EIGHT TO 10 PRODUCT CATEGORIES THAT RELY ON SOLVENTS.  RECIPIENT WILL CREATE VIDEOS, FLIERS, SPEC SHEETS AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS FOR SMALL BUSINESSES INCLUDING GAS STATIONS, GROCERY STORES, AUTO SHOPS AND MANUFACTURERS ON P2 BEST PRACTICES TO AVOID POLLUTION OF COMMUNITIES OF COLOR, HOMELESS AND LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES THAT ARE BEING ADVERSELY IMPACTED BY MANUFACTURING FACILITIES. DELIVERIES INCLUDE DEVELOPMENT OF 3-4 CASE STUDIES FOR THE SAFER ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS AND 1-2 CASE STUDIES ON THEIR WORK WITH BIPOC COMMUNITIES INCLUDING HISPANIC, TRIBAL, AND RURAL BUSINESSES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) PROJECT  WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., INFORMATION, TRAINING, TOOLS) TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2)). P2 MEANS REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POLLUTANTS FROM ENTERING ANY WASTE STREAM OR OTHERWISE BEING RELEASED INTO THE ENVIRONMENT PRIOR TO RECYCLING, TREATMENT, OR DISPOSAL. P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WORK WILL DEVELOP AN ONLINE TRAINING PORTAL FOR THE AUTOMOTIVE MAINTENANCE INDUSTRY, WITH MODULES THAT WILL TACKLE TOPICS FROM BEST PRACTICES TO ENCOURAGING THE P2 FOUNDATIONS AND FUNDAMENTALS THAT ARE CRITICAL FOR THESE BUSINESSES. ADEQ WILL IDENTIFY AND FOCUS ON BUSINESSES IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE (EJ) AREAS OF CONCERN WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF ACCESSIBLE BILINGUAL TRAINING MATERIALS AND GUIDANCE. THESE NEW RESOURCES WILL NOT ONLY TARGET SOURCE REDUCTION STRATEGIES THAT LEAD TO COST SAVINGS, BUT ALSO ENCOURAGE BUSINESSES TO BE BETTER STEWARDS OF THE ENVIRONMENT. THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE THE NECESSARY ASSISTANCE FOR THESE BUSINESSES TO REDUCE THEIR USE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES, GENERATION OF HAZARDOUS WASTE, AND CONSERVE MORE RESOURCES THROUGH THEIR EDUCATIONAL JOURNEY THEREBY EARNING THEM THE DESIGNATION OF 'ARIZONA'S SUSTAINABILITY STEWARDS'.  

THIS AWARD PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $296,594.ACTIVITIES:THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGN WITH ONE OR MORE OF THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS).  SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT(S) WILL ADDRESS INDUSTRIES IN NEA #3: AUTOMOTIVE MANUFACTURING AND MAINTENANCE (NAICS CODE 8111). ADEQ WILL DEVELOP ONLINE TRAINING MODULES AND GUIDANCE TO TARGET THE INDUSTRY IN EFFORTS TO PROMOTE CONSERVATION AND REDUCE WASTE GENERATION. ADEQ WILL WORK DIRECTLY WITH BUSINESSES TO DEVELOP CASE STUDIES AND RECEIVE STAKEHOLDER FEEDBACK TO HELP DEVELOP A USABLE AND BENEFICIAL TRAINING PROGRAM FOR FACILITIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. OUTREACH FOR TRAINING, CASE STUDIES, SIGNAGE AND GUIDANCE WILL BE CONDUCTED BOTH VIRTUALLY AND IN PERSON, WITH AN EMPHASIS IN EJ COMMUNITIES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CONDUCTED BY THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT FACILITIES AND, IF APPLICABLE, MAY ADDRESS UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THE GRANTEE IS EXPECTED TO REPORT ON P2 PERFORMANCE MEASURES (OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES) AND NOTE WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AS WELL AS COMMIT TO FOLLOWING-UP WITH FACILITIES TO FIND OUT WHETHER THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WAS ADOPTED AND IMPLEMENTED. SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANTEE ANTICIPATES PROVIDING: TWO SEPARATE SPREADSHEETS CAPTURING REPORTED DATA THAT FULFILLS REQUIRED OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES FROM THE REQUEST FOR APPLICATION (RFA), AND A P2 ACTIVITIES TRACKING LOG THAT CAPTURES P2 STAFF-RELATED INFORMATION SUPPORTING PROJECT COMPLETION, INCLUDING INFORMATION RELATING TO WEBINARS, INDUSTRY COMMUNICATIONS, CREATED P2 DOCUMENTS, AND AMPLIFICATION ACTIVITIES. EXPECTED OUTPUTS INCLUDE 5 TRAINING MODULES, 2 GUIDANCE DOCUMENTS, 2 SIGNAGE DOCUMENTS, 3 SHORT VIDEOS; AMPLIFICATION INCLUDING 2 WEBINARS, 2 TRAININGS, 5 OUTREACH EFFORTS WITH 2 WEBINARS AND 5 OUTREACH EFFORTS TARGETING UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. TRAINING MODULES AND GUIDANCE WILL BE AVAILABLE IN BOTH ENGLISH AND SPANISH TO REACH TARGET COMMUNITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., INFORMATION, TRAINING, TOOLS) TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION). SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANTEE ANTICIPATES PROVIDING THE FOLLOWING OUTPUTS: 112,000 POUNDS OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS REDUCED,  8,140 METRIC TONS OF CARBON DIOXIDE EQUIVALENT AVOIDED, 48,000,000 GALLONS OF WATER REDUCED, AND $1,372,000 SAVED. ESTIMATED OUTPUTS INCLUDE CASE STUDIES, 3 ROUNDTABLES, 4-8 POLLUTION PREVENTION WEBINARS, INTERN MARKETING VIDEOS, AND INTERNSHIPS. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE IOWA INDUSTRY, STUDENTS PARTICIPATING IN THE INTERN PROGRAM, AND IOWA ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., INFORMATION, TRAINING, TOOLS) TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2)). P2 MEANS REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POLLUTANTS FROM ENTERING ANY WASTE STREAM OR OTHERWISE BEING RELEASED INTO THE ENVIRONMENT PRIOR TO RECYCLING, TREATMENT, OR DISPOSAL. P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WORK WILL ACCOMPLISH SPECIFIC SOURCE-REDUCTION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE TO KANSAS BUSINESSES, ESPECIALLY THOSE IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES, UTILIZING TRAINED P2 STAFF AND INTERNS TO PROVIDE ON-SITE ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING. 
ACTIVITIES:THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGN WITH ONE OR MORE OF THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS).  SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT(S) WILL ADDRESS THE FOLLOWING: NEA #1 FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURING AND PROCESSING AND NEA #2 CHEMICAL MANUFACTURING, PROCESSING AND FORMULATION. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CONDUCTED BY THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT FACILITIES AND, IF APPLICABLE, MAY ADDRESS UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THE GRANTEE IS EXPECTED TO REPORT ON P2 PERFORMANCE MEASURES (OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES) AND NOTE WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AS WELL AS COMMIT TO FOLLOWING-UP WITH FACILITIES TO FIND OUT WHETHER THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WAS ADOPTED AND IMPLEMENTED. SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANTEE ANTICIPATES PROVIDING: DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO 50 BUSINESSES; ASSIST 120 BUSINESSES ASSISTANCE THROUGH HOTLINE CALLS; DEVELOP CASE STUDY AND 10 CASE SUMMARIES; HOST P2 INTERN SYMPOSIUM TO AMPLIFY RESULTS;  CONVENE A BUSINESS ROUNDTABLE BY SECTOR TO SHARE RESULTS; HOLD A WORKSHOP DESCRIBING CASE STUDIES; PROVIDE CONTINUING EDUCATION CREDITS FOR 36 STUDENTS IN POLLUTION PREVENTION TECHNIQUES; FOLLOW-UP WITH ATTENDEES/STUDENTS TO DETERMINE BEHAVIOR CHANGE; PRESENT AT THE KANSAS ENVIRONMENTAL CONFERENCE.

P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. 
REGION 8'S MONTANA POLLUTION PREVENTION PROGRAM (MTP2), HOUSED IN THE INSTITUTE ON ECOSYSTEMS (IOE)  AT MONTANA STATE UNIVERSITY (MSU), HAS SUCCESSFULLY FILLED AN IMPORTANT ROLE FOR TRAINING AND TECHNICAL  ASSISTANCE IN POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2) FOR MONTANA'S SMALL BUSINESSES FOR OVER 30 YEARS. TO BUILD UPON THEIR ACCOMPLISHMENTS AND AMPLIFY THE REACH OF THEIR PROGRAMMING, THE MTP2 PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO PARTNER WITH THE MONTANA MANUFACTURING EXTENSION CENTER (MMEC) AND WITH LAST BEST PLANET (FORMERLY UNCOMMON SENSE), A LEADERSHIP SUPPORT PROGRAM FOR BUSINESSES SEEKING TO OPERATE MORE EFFICIENTLY AND RESPONSIBLY. NEW THIS PROPOSAL, AND TO BETTER PROVIDE FOR THE NEEDS OF OUR REGION'S UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, MTP2 WILL PARTNER WITH THE SALISH KOOTENAI COLLEGE (SKC) TO HELP BRING AWARENESS TO THEIR TRADITIONAL ECOLOGICAL KNOWLEDGE (TEK) AND TO SUPPORT THEIR EFFORTS IN ACHIEVING ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE WHILE INCREASING THE NUMBER OF TRIBAL BUSINESSES AND STUDENTS IN THE MTP2 PROGRAM.

PERFOMANCE PARTNERSHIP GRANT FUNDS ARE USED BY THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT (CDPHE) TO PERFORM DELEGATED PROGRAM ACTIVITIES, PERFORM QUALITY ASSURANCE ACTIVITIES, AND MAINTAIN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL DATABASES ASSOCIATED WITH ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS. THESE INCLUDE CLEAN AIR, CLEAN WATER, HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT, SAFE DRINKING WATER, TOXICS MANAGEMENT AND ABATEMENT, AND POLLUTION PREVENTION. THE PERFORMANCE PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT PPA SERVES AS THE DEFINITIVE WORKPLAN FOR THE PERFORMANCE PARTNERSHIP GRANT (PPG). AS SUCH, THE PPA/PPG IN TANDEM PROVIDES THE STATE GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE STATE AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY.

MONTANA STATE UNIVERSITY (MSU) WILL USE THE FUNDS OF THIS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2) COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO OFFER MONTANA'S SMALL BUSINESSES IN THE FOOD AND BEVERAGE INDUSTRY ONSITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING TO INCLUDE: BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, SAFER CHEMICAL USE, P2 ROUNDTABLES, SOURCE REDUCTION TECHNIQUES AND COMMUNITY-BASED P2 INITIATIVES. ADDITIONALLY, WITH THE SUPPORT OF THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR APPROPRIATE TECHNOLOGY (NCAT), CLIENTS WILL RECEIVE ENERGY AUDITS TO IDENTIFY ENERGY CONSERVATION OPPORTUNITIES. FUNDING WILL ALSO SUPPORT STRATEGIC ENHANCEMENTS TO THE ECOSTAR P2 AWARD PROGRAM, MTP2.ORG WEBSITE, THE MONTANA MATERIAL EXCHANGE AND THE P2 RESOURCE LIBRARY. DESCRIPTION:THIS INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., INFORMATION, TRAINING, TOOLS) TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2)). P2 MEANS REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POLLUTANTS FROM ENTERING ANY WASTE STREAM OR OTHERWISE BEING RELEASED INTO THE ENVIRONMENT PRIOR TO RECYCLING, TREATMENT, OR DISPOSAL. P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. 

REGION 8'S MONTANA POLLUTION PREVENTION PROGRAM HAS FILLED AN IMPORTANT ROLE FOR TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING IN POLLUTION PREVENTION IN MONTANA FOR OVER 30 YEARS. IT IS THE GOAL OF MTP2 AND THEIR PARTNERS TO OFFER TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO AID THE FOOD AND BEVERAGE (FANDB) MANUFACTURING AND PROCESSING INDUSTRY AND OTHER SMALL BUSINESSES IN CREATING MORE EFFICIENT AND POLLUTION FREE PROCESSES, AS WELL AS TO STRENGTHEN PARTNERSHIPS TO INCREASE REPLICATION AND ACCOUNTABILITY. ADDITIONALLY, MTP2 STRIVES TO PROVIDE THIS SERVICE TO ALL THE PEOPLE OF OUR REGION, INCLUDING MONTANA'S TRIBES AND OTHER UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS, NEGATIVELY AFFECTED BY THE IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE AND A LACK OF ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE.
FUNDING OF THIS PROPOSAL WILL CREATE A NEW ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE (EJ) FOCUSED PROGRAM FOR MONTANA'S TRIBES; WILL STRATEGICALLY EXPAND EXISTING MTP2 PROGRAMS OFFERING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BUSINESSES IN THE FANDB MANUFACTURING INDUSTRIES; AND WILL FUND ASSISTANCE WITH AND PARTICIPATION IN A REGIONAL ROUNDTABLE.ACTIVITIES:THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGN WITH ONE OR MORE OF THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS).  SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT(S) WILL SUPPORT NEA 1: FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURING AND PROCESS INDUSTRY BY IMPLEMENTING THE FOLLOWING 4 PROJECTS:  
1) EJ - TEK INTEGRATION INTO P2 FRAMEWORK: A FIRST NATION'S PHD STUDENT WILL WORK WITH MONTANA STATE UNIVERSITY'S NATIVE AMERICAN STUDIES DEPARTMENT, THE SALISH KOOTENAI COLLEGE AND AN INTERTRIBAL ADVISORY COMMITTEE TO INTEGRATE TRADITIONAL ECOLOGICAL KNOWLEDGE WITH EXISTING P2 PRINCIPLES TO DESIGN A HOLISTIC APPROACH TO INCORPORATING P2 ON TRIBAL LANDS AND ADVANCE CONSIDERATIONS OF TEK INTO FEDERAL DECISION MAKING.
2) SUSTAINABLE BREWERY CERTIFICATION (SBC): PARTNERS WILL DEVELOP A STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE WORKSHOP ON CHEMICALS/CLEANING FOR BREWERIES. THE SBC WILL BE INTRODUCED STATEWIDE AT THE MONTANA BREWERS ASSOCIATION ANNUAL MEETING.
3) ECOSTAR LEADERSHIP AWARD: ECOSTAR AWARDEES WILL BE PROVIDED WITH A ONE DAY, ON-SITE, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TA) ASSESSMENT. AFTER EVALUATION, EACH AWARDEE WILL RECEIVE A $500 MINI GRANT TO JUMP START IMPLEMENTATION OF THE TA P2 RECOMMENDATIONS.
4) P2 REGIONAL ROUNDTABLE FY'24: MTP2 WILL ASSIST WITH AND ATTEND AN EPA REGIONAL ROUNDTABLE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CONDUCTED BY THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT FACILITIES AND, IF APPLICABLE, MAY ADDRESS UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THE GRANTEE IS EXPECTED TO REPORT ON P2 PERFORMANCE MEASURES (OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES) AND NOTE WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AS WELL AS COMMIT TO FOLLOWING-UP WITH FACILITIES TO FIND OUT WHETHER THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WAS ADOPTED AND IMPLEMENTED. 

SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANTEE WILL REPORT OUT ON OUTPUT/OUTCOME METRICS BY UTILIZING THE EPA'S P2 CALCULATORS, EPA'S LEAN AND ENVIRONMENT TOOLKIT, VALUE STREAM MAPPING, NIST-MEP CLEAN AND LEAN MANUFACTURING TOOLS, THE GREEN MANUFACTURING TOOL, PROCESS FLOW MAPPING, STATISTICAL PROCESS CONTROL, AND INDUSTRY 4.0. 100% OF BUSINESSES PROVIDED TA WILL BE SURVEYED TO ASSESS THE LEVEL OF IMPLEMENTATION OF P2 PLANS DERIVED FROM TA. DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., INFORMATION, TRAINING, TOOLS) TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2)). P2 MEANS REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POLLUTANTS FROM ENTERING ANY WASTE STREAM OR OTHERWISE BEING RELEASED INTO THE ENVIRONMENT PRIOR TO RECYCLING, TREATMENT, OR DISPOSAL. P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS FROM FOOD MANUFACTURERS THAT HAVE TOXIC RELEASES BY PROVIDING DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THREE FACILITIES. THE NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL FOCUS ON REDUCING THE FOLLOWING POLLUTANTS OF CONCERN: NITRIC ACID, NITRATE COMPOUNDS, AMMONIA, METHANOL, AND N-HEXANE. PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ONSITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, ENVIRONMENTAL AND ENERGY BENCHMARKING, EXPANSION OF THE NEW JERSEY SUSTAINABLE BUSINESS REGISTRY WEBSITE, AND PROMOTION OF PROJECT FINDINGS TO FOOD MANUFACTURERS AT EDUCATIONAL ROUNDTABLES.



ACTIVITIES:THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGNS WITH THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS).  SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS NEA #1: FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURING AND PROCESSING. THERE ARE 14 NEW JERSEY COMPANIES REPORTING TOXIC RELEASE INVENTORY (TRI) RELEASES WITH A NORTH AMERICAN INDUSTRY CLASSIFICATION SYSTEM (NAICS) CODE OF 311 FOR FOOD MANUFACTURING. NJDEP PROPOSES TO ADDRESS THE USE AND GENERATION OF TRI CHEMICALS REPORTED AT FOOD MANUFACTURING FACILITIES IN NEW JERSEY THROUGH P2 CASE STUDIES AT 3 FACILITIES. BASED ON THEIR TRI ANALYSIS, NJDEP WAS ABLE TO SELECT THE SUBSECTORS WITH THE HIGHEST CHEMICAL POLLUTION IMPACT, WHILE IDENTIFYING THE TOXIC CHEMICALS TO BE REDUCED FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT APPLICATION. TO ENSURE THE HIGHEST OUTCOME FOR THIS PROJECT, NJDEP VERIFIED HOW MANY FACILITIES ARE PRESENT IN NJ FOR EACH OF THESE FOUR SUBSECTORS (3112 GRAIN AND OILSEED MILLING, 3115 DAIRY PRODUCT MANUFACTURING, 3116 ANIMAL SLAUGHTERING AND PROCESSING, 3119 OTHER FOOD MANUFACTURING).  GIVEN THE ABUNDANCE OF FACILITIES IN THE 3115, 3116 AND 3119 SUBSECTORS (277 IN TOTAL), NJDEP SELECTED THESE THREE SUBSECTORS TO CARRY OUT THE CASE STUDIES. P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO REDUCE THE USE OF TRADITIONAL CHLORINE DISINFECTANT WHICH LEAVES CHLORINATED RESIDUALS THAT POTENTIALLY HARM HUMAN HEALTH, VEGETABLE QUALITY, AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THE JERSEY INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY (NJIT) WILL PROVIDE TRAINING TO FOOD PROCESSING FACILITIES ON OZONE NANOBUBBLE WATER WHICH IS A MORE BENIGN DISINFECTANT FOR REDUCING PATHOGENS AND MICROBIAL CONTAMINATION. NJIT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO VEGETABLE GROWERS AND WILL HOLD WORKSHOPS FOR THE COMMERCIAL GROWER INDUSTRY AND RETAIL GROCERIES ON ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY SURFACE AND PRODUCT DISINFECTION.  

ACTIVITIES:THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGNS WITH THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS).  SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS NEA #1: FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURING AND PROCESSING. THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON VEGETABLE GROWING, HARVESTING, PROCESSING, PACKAGING, AND CLEANING INCLUDING EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES ASSOCIATED WITH THESE ACTIVITIES UNDER TWO NORTH AMERICAN INDUSTRY CLASSIFICATION SYSTEM (NAICS) CODES: NAICS CODE 311 COVERS FOOD PROCESSING AND MANUFACTURING FACILITIES TRANSFORMING RAW ANIMALS, VEGETABLES OR MARINE MATERIALS INTO FOOD PRODUCTS.17 OTHER NAICS CODE 3121 FOR BEVERAGE MANUFACTURING FACILITIES PRODUCE SOFT DRINKS, ICE, PURIFIED/BOTTLED WATER, AND BREWERY/WINERY/DISTILLERY PRODUCTS MAY ALSO BENEFIT FROM THE RESEARCH OUTCOMES AS THEY MAY ALSO USE OZONE NBS FOR DISINFECTION OF CONTAINERS OR PRODUCE WATER. THE RELEVANT ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH AND SAFETY CONCERNS INCLUDE TOXIC RELEASE INVENTORY (TRI) REPORTED CHEMICALS THAT RESULT IN ADVERSE ENVIRONMENTAL EFFECTS AND CHRONIC/ACUTE ADVERSE HUMAN HEALTH EFFECTS. ACCORDING TO THE P2 NEA FACT SHEET (FY 22-23), APPROXIMATELY 1,707 FACILITIES COVERED BY NAICS CODE 311 AND 3121 WERE REPORTED TO TOXIC RELEASE INVENTORY (TRI) IN 2020.20 GENERALLY, THESE FACILITIES PRODUCED 162 MILLION LB OF ON-SITE AND OFF-SITE WASTES IN THE INVESTIGATED YEAR. ALTHOUGH THE TYPES OF TRI CHEMICALS VARY IN DIFFERENT FACILITIES, CHLORINE-BASED DISINFECTANTS AND BYPRODUCTS HAVE BEEN POLLUTIONS FROM NAICS CODE 311 AND 3121 SOURCES WITH EXTENSIVE CONCERNS. THIS CONSIDERABLE QUANTITY OF WASTE THEREBY INCREASED THE CHEMICAL OXYGEN DEMAND (COD) OF VEGETABLE PROCESSING FACILITIES EFFLUENT TO 7000 MGMIDDOT;L-1, BY COMPARING WITH EPA 7-DAY LIMIT OF 40 MGMIDDOT;L-1.10, 22 PARTICULARLY, WITH THE COMMONLY UTILIZED CHLORINATION DISINFECTING PROCESS, CARCINOGENIC BYPRODUCTS BY CHLORINATION OF DISSOLVED ORGANIC MATTER (DOM), SUCH AS TRIHALOMETHANES (THMS), ALSO INTRODUCES SIGNIFICANT PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY ISSUES. BY USING THE EPA'S P2-EJ FACILITY MAPPING TOOL,23 TOTALLY 83 FACILITIES ARE IDENTIFIED AND LOCATED IN EPA REGION 2 NEA #1- NAICS CODE 311 AND 3121, WITH TRI REPORTED.SUBRECIPIENT:THE APPLICANT INTENDS TO GIVE A SUBAWARD OF $102,132 U.S. DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, AGRICULTURAL RESEACH SERVICE (USDA-ARS) TO PERFORM KEY PROJECT TASKS.  SPECIFICALLY, USDA-ARS WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH THREE SOILLESS PRODUCERS IN NJ TO DEMONSTRATE THE EFFICACY AND COST-BENEFITS OF NANO BUBBLES FOR DISINFECTION OF PRODUCE, PROCESS WATER, AND EQUIPMENT, AS WELL AS THE EASE OF IMPLEMENTING/MANAGING THE TECHNOLOGY. ASSISTANCE WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT BY A STUDENT AND A TECHNICIAN TRAINING IN AGRICULTURAL EXTENSION FROM THE UN

NEW JERSEY INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY (NJIT) WILL DEVELOP BENIGN ALTERNATIVES TO CURRENT METAL LEACHING PROCESSES FOR WASTE LITHIUM-ION BATTERIES. CURRENT MAINSTREAM METAL LEACHING PROCESSES FOR WASTE BATTERIES INVOLVE THE EXTENSIVE USE OF HAZARDOUS AND CORROSIVE ACIDS AND BASES. NJIT WILL DEVELOP BENIGN ALTERNATIVES AND WILL PILOT THEIR USE IN LEACHING PROCESSES IN SELECTED FACILITIES. RESULTS WILL BE SHARED THOUGH WORKSHOPS, EDUCATIONAL CURRICULA, AND DISSEMINATED BY STATE AND LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY WILL DEVELOP AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO NEW JERSEY'S WINERY INDUSTRY IN ORDER TO ASSIST WINERIES IN REDUCING THEIR ENERGY AND WATER CONSUMPTION, IMPROVING THEIR WASTEWATER MANAGEMENT, AND SAVING MONEY THROUGH REDUCED RESOURCE USE AND WASTE DISPOSAL. RUTGERS WILL DEVELOP BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, AND WILL HOST WORKSHOPS AND TRAINING SESSIONS FOR ALL NEW JERSEY WINERIES.  RUTGERS WILL SELECT FOUR WINERIES FOR ONSITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND WILL DISSEMINATE THE RESULTS AND LESSONS LEARNED THROUGH CASE STUDIES WITH WINERIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.

ROWAN UNIVERSITY WILL PROVIDE POLLUTION PREVENTION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THE EXXONMOBIL LUBRICANTS AND OIL BLENDING PLANT IN PAULSBORO, NEW JERSEY. THIS IS A LARGE FACILITY THAT SUPPLIES MANY DIFFERENT TYPES OF LUBE-OIL PRODUCTS TO AUTOMOTIVE MANUFACTURERS AND CONSUMER DISTRIBUTORS, AND GENERATES SIGNIFICANT WASTE OIL BY-PRODUCTS. ROWAN INTENDS TO PROVIDE ALTERNATIVE FLUSHING AND CLEANING TECHNOLOGIES TO MINIMIZE OIL WASTE AND ENCOURAGE OIL RECOVERY FROM LUBE OIL MIXTURES. RESULTS THROUGH CASE STUDIES WILL BE SHARED THROUGHOUT THE OIL-BASED CHEMICALS AND AUTOMOTIVE PRODUCTS SECTOR.

DESCRIPTION:THIS INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., INFORMATION, TRAINING, TOOLS) TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2)). P2 MEANS REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POLLUTANTS FROM ENTERING ANY WASTE STREAM OR OTHERWISE BEING RELEASED INTO THE ENVIRONMENT PRIOR TO RECYCLING, TREATMENT, OR DISPOSAL. P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SNOW AND ICE MANAGER (SIM) BUSINESSES ON THE ST. REGIS MOHAWK TRIBE (SRMT) RESERVATION TO REDUCE ROADWAY SALT CONTAMINATION AND ITS IMPACTS ON WATER QUALITY, DAMAGE TO THE ENVIRONMENT, AND HUMAN HEALTH. SRMT WILL ASSESS CURRENT ROAD SALT STORAGE, HANDLING PRACTICES AND IMPROVEMENT OPPORTUNITIES, AND WILL DEVELOP BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (BMPS) BY BENCHMARKING SALT APPLICATION RATES OF SIMS AND COMPARING IT WITH NATIONAL TRENDS.  SRMT WILL THEN PROVIDE TRAINING ON BMPS TO SIMS THROUGH DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND WORKSHOPS. THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT WILL BE A REDUCTION IN THE USE OF ROAD SALT, AND REDUCTIONS IN CHLORIDE LEVELS IN WATER AND SOIL.  A CASE STUDY THAT WILL BE POSTED ON THE TRIBE'S WEBSITE; PRESENTED AT TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL MEETINGS; AND SHARED AT REGIONAL NATURAL RESOURCES CONFERENCES AND WORKSHOPS.ACTIVITIES:THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGNS WITH THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS).  SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS NEA #6 (SUPPORTING POLLUTION PREVENTION IN INDIAN COUNTRY AND FOR ALASKA NATIVE VILLAGES).  TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WILL BE PROVIDED TO EJ AND UNDERSERVED SIMS IN THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY IN THE FORM OF:

-	DISCOVERY THROUGH ENGINEERING AND CONSULTING SERVICES OF SALT STORAGE FACILITIES, HANDLING AND APPLICATION PRACTICES FOR BENCHMARKING OPPORTUNITIES FOR IMPROVEMENT;
-	DELIVERY OF TRAINING IN P2 BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES AND TOOLS AND APPS THAT LEAD ROAD SALT REDUCTION;
-	COORDINATION WITH ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCE MANAGERS IN THE IDENTIFICATION OF NO/LOW SALT AREAS NEAR SENSITIVE FRESHWATER;
-	ENCOURAGEMENT ADOPTION OF ROAD SALT P2 PRACTICES AND VALUE-ADDED SERVICES FOR BUSINESS SERVICES OPERATING IN THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY; AND;
-	SUPPORTING SUSTAINABLE P2 PRACTICES THAT LEAD TO REDUCTIONS IN SALT APPLICATION AND COLLATERALLY REDUCE OPERATING COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH ROAD SALT INVENTORY AND USAGE, AND 
        MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR COSTS OF SALT DELIVERY EQUIPMENT/VEHICLES.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CONDUCTED BY THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT FACILITIES AND, IF APPLICABLE, MAY ADDRESS UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THE GRANTEE IS EXPECTED TO REPORT ON P2 PERFORMANCE MEASURES (OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES) AND NOTE WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AS WELL AS COMMIT TO FOLLOWING-UP WITH FACILITIES TO FIND OUT WHETHER THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WAS ADOPTED AND IMPLEMENTED. OVERALL, THE PROJECT'S SUCCESS AND OBJECTIVES WILL BE MEASURED BY:  

IDENTIFICATION OF SUCCESS/OBJECTIVES:
-	LOWERED/REDUCED SALT MEASURED AS CHLORIDE LEVELS IN WATER RESOURCES
-	INCREASED ECONOMIC VALUE OF SIMS SERVICES IN THE FORM OF 'VALUE ADDED SERVICES'
-	INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF ROAD SALT IMPACTS TO WATER AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCES
-	INCREASED CAPACITY TO UNDERSTAND AND IMPLEMENT BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES
-	DECREASED SNOW AND ICE MANAGEMENT DIRECT COSTS
-	DECREASED ENERGY AND CO2 EMISSIONS

SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANTEE ANTICIPATES PROVIDING THE FOLLOWING: 

OUTPUTS
-	NUMBER OF TRAININGS HELD WITH SIMS
-	NUMBER OF OUTREACH ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED AT TRIBAL AND BUSINESS LOCATION

IN THEIR TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, ROWAN UNIVERSITY WILL USE INNOVATIVE TECHNIQUES OF ENHANCING PROCESS SUSTAINABILITY, SCALABILITY, AND SAFER DESIGN WITH THE AID OF MACHINE LEARNING, AND COMPUTATIONAL PROCESS DESIGN. SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANTEE ANTICIPATES PROVIDING: 

OUTPUTS:

-	DOCUMENTING THE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE (EJ) DEMOGRAPHICS IN NEIGHBORING AREAS OF ALL THE ASTRAZENECA FACILITIES PROVIDED P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE VIA THE P2 EJ TOOL
-	IN-PERSON VISITS, VIRTUAL DISCUSSIONS AND UPDATES WITH OUR INDUSTRIAL PARTNERS, AND CONDUCTING SEMI-ANNUAL REVIEW SESSIONS
-	DISSEMINATION EFFORTS RESULTING IN AT LEAST 4 PRESENTATIONS AT REGIONAL/NATIONAL CONFERENCES, 3 JOURNAL PUBLICATIONS, AND SEVERAL PRESS RELEASES/NEWSLETTER ARTICLES
-	MACHINE LEARNING TOOLS FOR LIFE CYCLE INVENTORY AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS PREDICTION
-	A CASE STUDY USING NEW AND SAFER ALTERNATIVE CHEMICALS, COMPARISON OF PERFORMANCE AS COMPARED TO THE ONGOING PROCESS IN THE PARTNERING FACILITY RESULTING IN AN EASY TO 
        UNDERSTAND FACT SHEET
-	OUTREACH TO SCHOOLS IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES TO EMPHASIZE THE IMPORTANCE OF THE SAFER CHOICE OF CHEMICALS, SOLVENTS, AND USE OF DATA SCIENCE FOR EXTRAPOLATING 
        INFORMATION

ROWAN STRONGLY BELIEVES THAT THE P2 METHODS AND OUTCOMES CAN TRANSLATE TO OTHER TOP CHEMICAL WASTE GENERATING INDUSTRIES IN THE UNITED STATES AND BEYOND. THEIR ONGOING COLLABORATION WITH ASTRAZENECA HELPED US IN UNDERSTANDING THE NEEDS AND LIMITATIONS OF PHARMACEUTICAL PROCESSES. SPENT SOLVENTS ARE ONE OF THE MAJOR CHEMICAL RELEASES FROM THE PHARMACEUTICAL AND SPECIALTY CHEMICAL INDUSTRIES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (COMMONLY REFERRED TO AS THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW) FUNDED GRANT WILL ALLOW THE UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., INFORMATION, TRAINING, TOOLS) TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2)). P2 MEANS REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POLLUTANTS FROM ENTERING ANY WASTE STREAM OR OTHERWISE BEING RELEASED INTO THE ENVIRONMENT PRIOR TO RECYCLING, TREATMENT, OR DISPOSAL. P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE VIA ENERGY AND WASTE ASSESSMENTS FOR METAL FABRICATION AND MANUFACTURING FACILITIES IN EPA REGION III. THESE WILL INCLUDE ONE TO TWO DAY SITE ASSESSMENTS WITH DOCUMENTED FINDINGS, RECOMMENDATIONS, AND COST-EFFECTIVENESS INFORMATION PROVIDED TO FACILITY MANAGERS AND OPERATORS.ACTIVITIES:THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGN WITH ONE OR MORE OF THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS).  SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT(S) WILL  OFFER TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF ENERGY AUDITS, RESULTING IN ENERGY USE REDUCTION AND ASSOCIATED REDUCTION OF GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS. THE UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE'S INDUSTRIAL ASSESSMENT CENTER (THE CENTER) WILL IDENTIFY AND ENGAGE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CLIENTS AND ASSESS THEIR ENERGY (AND WATER AND WASTE) USE. FOR EACH CLIENT, THE CENTER WILL DESCRIBE AND QUANTIFY A SET OF ENERGY, WATER, AND WASTE (WHERE POSSIBLE) REDUCTION RECOMMENDATIONS, DELIVER THEM IN A COMPREHENSIVE REPORT, AND FOLLOW UP WITH CLIENT EDUCATION ON HOW TO IMPLEMENT THE RECOMMENDATIONS. LASTLY, THE CENTER WILL RECORD AND REPORT TO WHAT EXTENT THE RECOMMENDATIONS HAVE BEEN IMPLEMENTED.SUBRECIPIENT:A SUBAWARD WILL BE ISSUED TO PENNTAP TO CONDUCT 12 POLLUTION PREVENTION AUDITS. THE POLLUTION PREVENTION ASSESSMENT PROCESS INVOLVES A COMPLETE EXAMINATION OF A BUSINESS'S PROCESS(ES) AND/OR FACILITY WITH RECOMMENDATIONS FOR ENERGY USE REDUCTIONS, PRODUCTIVITY IMPROVEMENTS, WASTE REDUCTIONS, WATER USE REDUCTIONS AND COST SAVINGS.

 OUTCOMES:THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CONDUCTED BY THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT FACILITIES AND, IF APPLICABLE, MAY ADDRESS UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANTEE WILL FULFILL THE EPA P2 APPROACH OF IMPLEMENTING WATER AND ENERGY CONSERVATION PRACTICES VIA ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BUSINESSES IN THE FORM OF ENERGY AUDITS, WHICH IDENTIFY AND QUANTIFY A SET OF ENERGY (AND WATER) SAVINGS RECOMMENDATIONS.  THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE METAL FABRICATION AND MANUFACTURING FACILITIES IN EPA REGION III.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION PARTIALLY FUNDS THE GRANT IN THE AMOUNT OF $116,152.  FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $131,346 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY OF ADDITIONAL FUNDING.  

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., INFORMATION, TRAINING, TOOLS) TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2)). P2 MEANS REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POLLUTANTS FROM ENTERING ANY WASTE STREAM OR OTHERWISE BEING RELEASED INTO THE ENVIRONMENT PRIOR TO RECYCLING, TREATMENT, OR DISPOSAL. P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SMALL AND MEDIUM SIZED ENTERPRISES (SMES) THAT FALL WITHIN NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS) IN WEST VIRGINIA AND THE SURROUNDING REGION.  THE NEW AND THE TRADITIONAL P2 APPROACHES WILL BE USED TO ASSIST THE REGIONAL SMES WITH LOWERING THEIR OPERATIONAL COSTS BY REDUCING EXPENDITURES, WATER AND ENERGY USE, WASTE, AND DISPOSAL COSTS TO INCREASE THEIR OVERALL PRODUCTIVITY. 
ACTIVITIES:THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGN WITH ONE OR MORE OF THE PROGRAM'S NEAS.  SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT(S) WILL ADDRESS NEAS THROUGH ACTIVITIES LIKE TRAINING WORKSHOPS, ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, A CONFERENCE WITH THEMED ROUNDTABLES, AND OFF-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES. NEW P2 BEST PRACTICES BASED ON THE LATEST SMART MANUFACTURING AND DATA-DRIVEN METHODOLOGIES WILL BE IDENTIFIED AND DEVELOPED INTO TRAINING.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CONDUCTED BY THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT FACILITIES AND, IF APPLICABLE, MAY ADDRESS UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THE GRANTEE IS EXPECTED TO REPORT ON P2 PERFORMANCE MEASURES (OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES) AND NOTE WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AS WELL AS COMMIT TO FOLLOWING-UP WITH FACILITIES TO FIND OUT WHETHER THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WAS ADOPTED AND IMPLEMENTED. SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANTEE ANTICIPATES PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS THAT WILL GENERATE IMPACTFUL AND MEASURABLE RESULTS FOR P2 BY ELIMINATING IMPEDIMENTS TO SOURCE REDUCTION AND BY MOTIVATING SMES IN THE REGION TO RECONSIDER THEIR PROCESSES AND OPERATIONS BY ADOPTING AND IMPLEMENTING P2 PRACTICES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE SMALL AND MEDIUM SIZED ENTERPRISES.

THIS PROJECT IS A COORDINATED APPROACH TO INFLUENCE PRACTICES THAT REDUCE OR ELIMINATE WATER, AIR, AND SOLID WASTE POLLUTION AT AUTO BODY AND REPAIR BUSINESSES. THIS PROJECT WILL CREATE AN EFFECTIVE, UNIFIED MESSAGE ABOUT HOW TO REDUCE POLLUTION THROUGH SOURCE REDUCTION.SUBRECIPIENT:DC DOEE'S SUBAWARD GRANTEE WILL PROVIDE EXPERT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND EDUCATION TO AUTO REPAIR BUSINESSES BY DEVELOPING A CUSTOMIZED POLLUTION PREVENTION PLAN, PROVIDING TRAINING, AND IMPLEMENTING P2 BUSINESS MANAGEMENT PLANS. DC DOEE WILL ALSO WORK WITH ITS TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE SUB-GRANTEE TO SELECT A BUSINESS PARTNER TO PILOT A CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT. THIS PROGRAM WILL HELP AN AUTOMOTIVE REPAIR BUSINESS UTILIZE LOCAL INCENTIVES, WHICH WILL ASSIST WITH THE BUILDOUT OF NEEDED CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE, ATTRACT BUSINESSES, AND CREATE A REPLICABLE MODEL FOR OTHER BUSINESSES.  THIS EFFORT WILL ADD 20 ADDITIONAL BUSINESSES, EDUCATE 150 ADDITIONAL STUDENTS ,WHILE PROMOTING SUSTAINABLE ENERGY, AND SUPPORT HYBRID AND ELECTRIC VEHICLES. OUTCOMES:THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CONDUCTED BY THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT FACILITIES AND, IF APPLICABLE, MAY ADDRESS UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANTEE ANTICIPATES PROVIDING REPORTS THAT WILL INCLUDE THE RAW DATA AND AN APPROPRIATE ANALYSIS OF THE DATA COLLECTED. THIS DATA WILL INCLUDE POUNDS OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS AND EMISSIONS REDUCED, GALLONS OF WATER SAVED, METRIC TONS OF CARBON DIOXIDE EQUIVALENTS REDUCED (MTCO2E), AND DOLLARS SAVED BY BUSINESSES THROUGH IMPLEMENTING P2 BUSINESS MANAGEMENT PRACTICES. THE REPORT WILL ALSO INCLUDE AN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMPONENT.   THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT ARE LOW INCOME UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE WESTERN PENNSYLVANIA MANUFACTURERS LOCATED IN OVERBURDENED AND VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES SO THAT LEGACY POLLUTION CONCERNS THAT DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACT SUCH COMMUNITIES MAY BE ADDRESSED.

DESCRIPTION:THIS INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (COMMONLY REFERRED TO AS THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW) FUNDED GRANT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., INFORMATION, TRAINING, TOOLS) TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2)). P2 MEANS REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POLLUTANTS FROM ENTERING ANY WASTE STREAM OR OTHERWISE BEING RELEASED INTO THE ENVIRONMENT PRIOR TO RECYCLING, TREATMENT, OR DISPOSAL. P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. SPECIFICALLY, THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND ENVIRONMENTAL FINANCE CENTER WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SMALL BREWERY BUSINESSES IN DELAWARE AND SOUTHEAST PENNSYLVANIA TO HELP THEM ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES THAT WILL IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOMES WHILE REDUCING BUSINESS COSTS.  

ACTIVITIES:THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGN WITH ONE OR MORE OF THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS). SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT(S) WILL REFINE A P2 BENCHMARKING AND ASSESSMENT TOOL, TRAIN THIRTY (30) BREWERIES, AND DEVELOP GUIDANCE FOR BEVERAGE MANUFACTURERS TO FINALIZE P2 CAPITAL UPGRADES WHILE SHARING BEST PRACTICES THAT WILL MEASURE OUTCOMES.  ACTIVITIES OF THIS PROJECT ALSO INCLUDE CREATING TWO (2) CASE STUDIES.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CONDUCTED BY THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT FACILITIES AND, IF APPLICABLE, MAY ADDRESS UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THE GRANTEE IS EXPECTED TO REPORT ON P2 PERFORMANCE MEASURES (OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES) AND NOTE WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AS WELL AS COMMIT TO FOLLOWING-UP WITH FACILITIES TO FIND OUT WHETHER THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WAS ADOPTED AND IMPLEMENTED.  SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANTEE WILL PROVIDE DIRECT ASSISTANCE TO  BREWERIES LOCATED IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.  THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THE GRANT ARE THE UNDERSERVED COMMUNTIES LOCATED IN DELAWARE AND SOUTHEAST PENNSYLVANIA.

SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WORK WILL PROVIDE P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO AT LEAST FOURTEEN (14) ELIGIBLE FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURING AND PROCESSING BUSINESSES, AEROSPACE PRODUCT AND PARTS MANUFACTURING AND MAINTENANCE BUSINESSES, AND METAL MANUFACTURING AND FABRICATION BUSINESSES. 

ACTIVITIES:THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGN WITH ONE OR MORE OF THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS).  SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THAT WILL INCREASE THE UNDERSTANDING AND ADOPTION OF P2 PRACTICES AIMED AT REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POLLUTANTS BEING RELEASED INTO THE ENVIRONMENT. P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE METHODS WILL INCLUDE INVESTIGATION, STUDY, LIMITED DEMONSTRATIONS, EDUCATION, TRAINING, ON-SITE ASSESSMENTS, WEBINARS, A CASE STUDY, AND DISSEMINATION OF PROJECT FINDINGS. ACTIVITIES WILL ALSO INCLUDE ESTABLISHING BASELINE EMISSIONS FOR BUSINESS OPERATIONS; ASSESSING OPERATIONS ON-SITE; IDENTIFYING P2 OPPORTUNITIES; PREPARING AND PRESENTING COST AND LIABILITY-BENEFIT ANALYSES OF RECOMMENDED P2 STRATEGIES; PROVIDING P2 IMPLEMENTATION SUPPORT; AND SHARING BEST PRACTICES AND LESSONS LEARNED. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CONDUCTED BY THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT FACILITIES AND, IF APPLICABLE, MAY ADDRESS UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THE GRANTEE IS EXPECTED TO REPORT ON P2 PERFORMANCE MEASURES (OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES) AND NOTE WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AS WELL AS COMMIT TO FOLLOWING-UP WITH FACILITIES TO FIND OUT WHETHER THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WAS ADOPTED AND IMPLEMENTED. SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANTEE ANTICIPATES PROVIDING ACTIVITIES THAT WILL SUPPORT EPA IN PROMOTING POLLUTION PREVENTION IN SECTOR-FOCUSED NEAS, ENABLE THE REPLICATION AND LEVERAGING OF BUSINESS SUCCESSES SUPPORTED BY POLLUTION PREVENTION GRANTS, AND PROVIDE TRAINING AND OUTREACH FOR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE MANUFACTURERS IN EASTERN PA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., INFORMATION, TRAINING, TOOLS) TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2)). P2 MEANS REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POLLUTANTS FROM ENTERING ANY WASTE STREAM OR OTHERWISE BEING RELEASED INTO THE ENVIRONMENT PRIOR TO RECYCLING, TREATMENT, OR DISPOSAL. P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (IDEQ) WILL PROVIDE DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO FACILITIES THROUGH A COHORT TA MODEL CONSISTING OF INDUSTRY ROUNDTABLES, WEBINARS, AND ONSITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. IDEQ WILL PAIR P2 TA PROVIDERS AND BUSINESSES TO DEVELOP P2 ACTION PLANS SPECIFIC AND APPROPRIATE FOR EACH FACILITY, WHICH WILL ENSURE IMPLEMENTATION. PARTICIPATING BUSINESSES WILL COMMIT TO IMPLEMENTING P2 ACTIONS THAT RESULT IN MEASURABLE REDUCTIONS OF THE IDENTIFIED PRIORITY POLLUTANT. EACH BUSINESS WILL BE PAIRED WITH A P2 TA PROVIDER TO DEVELOP A TEN-YEAR BASELINE OF USE, GENERATION, AND/OR RELEASE OF THE PRIORITY POLLUTANT AGAINST WHICH P2 IMPLEMENTATION IMPACT WILL BE MEASURED. IDEQ WILL HOLD MONTHLY ACTION PLAN MEETINGS TO ENSURE TIMELY IMPLEMENTATION AND DETAILED REPORTING. IN ADDITION TO MAKING RECOMMENDATIONS, THE AQS WILL PROVIDE EDUCATION AND TRAINING TO ACHIEVE THE PROJECT GOAL. TEPA WILL ANALYZE AIR AND WATER SAMPLES AT THE FACILITIES TO DETERMINE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE RECOMMENDED CHANGES. AT THE CONCLUSION OF THE PROJECT, A CASE STUDY WILL BE GENERATED.

ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP INITIATIVE IS A PERFORMANCE-BASED PROGRAM THAT ADDRESSES ALL FIVE INDUSTRIAL SECTOR NEAS BY WORKING TO IMPROVE SUSTAINABILITY IN BUSINESSES AND OTHER ENTITIES IN NORTH CAROLINA USING THE ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT SYSTEM MODEL AND P2 PRACTICES.  CURRENTLY, THE ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP INITIATIVE HAS 34 ACTIVE MEMBERS COVERED BY THE FIVE NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS INDUSTRY SECTORS WITH THE MOST MEMBERS NOTED WITHIN NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS #3. THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED THROUGH THIS GRANT INCLUDE: 25 ESI TRAININGS, WORKSHOPS, NETWORKING AND BEST PRACTICE SHARING EVENTS, OR OTHER AMPLIFICATION/OUTREACH/EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES ON P2 STRATEGIES AND SOURCE REDUCTION TECHNIQUES; 40 P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON-SITE VISITS; 450 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE RESPONSES. SUBRECIPIENT:IN ORDER TO ENGAGE TECHNICAL PARTNER RESOURCES AND EXPERTISE, NCDEQ WILL WORK DURING THE GRANT CYCLE WITH LAND OF SKY'S WASTE REDUCTION PARTNERS (WRP) TO PROVIDE ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ESI MEMBERS AND PROSPECTIVE MEMBERS IN NORTH CAROLINA THROUGH A SUB-AWARD. WRP UTILIZES A UNIQUE STATEWIDE TEAM OF 35 ENGINEERS, SCIENTISTS AND ARCHITECTS TO PROVIDE P2 AND ENERGY EFFICIENCY ASSISTANCE THOUGH COST-BENEFIT OPPORTUNITY REPORTS AND MENTORING. THE WRP PROGRAM REPORTS A 65% ADOPTION RATE OF THE P2 RECOMMENDATIONS PROVIDED. WITH THIS SUBAWARD, WRP WILL WORK WITH 12 NORTH CAROLINA ESI MEMBER OR PROSPECTIVE MEMBER INDUSTRIES AND ORGANIZATIONS (TERMED 'CLIENTS'). THE SCOPE OF SUB- AWARD WORK WILL INCLUDE ONE-ON-ONE, ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WITH A CLIENT'S LEADERSHIP TEAM TO IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL AND ENERGY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS THROUGH POLLUTION PREVENTION STRATEGIES THAT ACHIEVE SOURCE REDUCTION, RESOURCE EFFICIENCIES, UTILITY COST CONTROLS, TO HELP THE CLIENT BECOME MORE ECONOMICALLY COMPETITIVE AND ENVIRONMENTALLY SUSTAINABLE. WRP ENGINEERS ASSESS AND PROVIDE WRITTEN REPORTS WHICH IDENTIFY ENERGY, WATER AND WASTE COST-SAVING OPPORTUNITIES, ADDRESS GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSION INVENTORIES, SCOPE UTILITY-SAVING PROJECTS, ASSIST WITH IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGIES AND DOCUMENT CLIENT ADOPTION RATES. A TYPICAL CLIENT ASSISTED IS EXPECTED TO REDUCE THEIR TOTAL ENERGY BUDGET BY 3 TO 7 PERCENT, REDUCE ENERGY CONSUMPTION BY 1,470 MMBTU ANNUALLY, CUT WATER USE BY ON AVERAGE 175,000 GALLONS PER YEAR, REDUCE SOLID WASTE THROUGH SOURCE REDUCTION BY AN AVERAGE OF 47,000 POUNDS PER YEAR AND ACHIEVE ANNUAL UTILITY SAVINGS OF $22,500, ASSUMING A 65% IMPLEMENTATION RATE OF P2 RECOMMENDATIONS. IMPLEMENTED CLIENT UTILITY COST-SAVINGS ARE PROJECTED TO BE $450,000 ANNUALLY. THIS SUB-AWARD WILL ALSO INCLUDE THE CREATION OF AT LEAST ONE P2 BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICE CASE STUDY WHICH WILL BE DISTRIBUTED TO THE CURRENT ESI MEMBERSHIP TO HELP AMPLIFY THE ADOPTION FOR AN INNOVATIVE AND COST EFFECTIVE P2 STRATEGY. OUTCOMES:THE TECHNICAL ASSIST

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $174,250 TO EAST CAROLINA UNIVERSITY TO SUPPORT THEIR PROJECT THAT WILL REDUCE POLLUTION, CONSERVE WATER, AND SAVE ENERGY THROUGH LEAN AND GREEN PRACTICES IN MANUFACTURING FACILITIES IN NORTH CAROLINA. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2)).ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES OF THE PROJECT WILL BE ACHIEVED THROUGH ENERGY, P2, WATER, AND LEAN ON-SITE ASSESSMENTS; ENERGY AUDITS OF SPECIFIED SYSTEMS; REGIONAL WORKSHOPS ON P2 AND SAFER CHOICE; ROUNDTABLE DISCUSSIONS; ONSITE TRAINING; AND ONE-DAY TRAINING WORKSHOPS IN P2, LEAN 100, AND ENVIRONMENTAL AND ENERGY MANAGEMENT. THE PROJECT WILL BE LED BY THE EAST CAROLINA UNIVERSITY P2 AND LEAN MANUFACTURING TEAM IN PARTNERSHIP WITH MULTIPLE CENTERS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN NC. THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CONDUCTED BY THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT NORTH CAROLINA MANUFACTURING FACILITIES AND WILL ADDRESS UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NORTH CAROLINA STATE UNIVERSITY WILL RECEIVE A SUBAWARD TO CONDUCT 6 ON-SITE ENERGY ASSESSMENTS OF SPECIFIED SYSTEMS. THE ASSESSMENTS WILL BE CONDUCTED BY THE NC STATE UNIVERSITY CLEAN ENERGY TECHNOLOGY CENTER (NCSU CETC). THESE ASSESSMENTS WILL TARGET ONE OR TWO MAJOR ENERGY CONSUMPTION UNITS IN EACH FACILITY AND IDENTIFY NO- OR LOW-COST IMPROVEMENTS FOR INCREASED EFFICIENCY OPTIMIZATION USING SIMPLE PAYBACK DETERMINED THROUGH A DETAILED ENGINEERING ANALYSIS. FINAL DELIVERABLES WILL BE COMPILED IN TECHNICAL REPORTS THAT INCLUDE FUNDING OPPORTUNITIES AS LOANS, GRANTS, OR OTHER INCENTIVES FOR ELIGIBLE CLIENTS. OUTCOMES:THE GRANTEE IS EXPECTED TO REPORT ON P2 PERFORMANCE MEASURES (OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES) AND NOTE WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AS WELL AS COMMIT TO FOLLOWING-UP WITH FACILITIES TO FIND OUT WHETHER THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WAS ADOPTED AND IMPLEMENTED. SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANTEE ANTICIPATES PROVIDING: 20 ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSESSMENTS, 10 IN-PERSON TECHNICAL TRAINING COURSES, 1 P2 ROUNDTABLE DISCUSSION, 8 WEBINARS, 2 REGIONAL WORKSHOPS, 2 CASE STUDIES, 1 RESOURCE WEBPAGE. ESTIMATED OUTCOMES FOR THE FOOD AND BEVERAGE INDUSTRY (ONE OF FIVE NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS) INVOLVE THE REDUCTION OF THE FOLLOWING: 299,841 KG/YR. CO2; 150 KG/YR. CO; 1,500 KG/YR. SO2; 525 KG/YR. NOX; 0.4 LITERS OF WATER/LITER OF WINE; AND 0.6 LITERS OF WATER/LITER OF BEER.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $80,000 TO THE TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND CONSERVATION TO SUPPORT TENNESSEE'S POLLUTION PREVENTION PROGRAM. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES.ACTIVITIES:THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGN WITH ONE OR MORE OF THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS). THE PROJECT WILL PLACE EMPHASIS ON NEA #1 FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURING AND NEA #3 AUTOMOTIVE MANUFACTURING AND MAINTENANCE. SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WORK WILL PROVIDE WORKSHOPS, ROUNDTABLES, AND SUPPORT TO TENNESSEE MANUFACTURERS TO ACHIEVE MEASURABLE RESULTS IN POLLUTION PREVENTION, GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS, AND ASSOCIATED COST SAVINGS AS WELL AS ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SPIRITS PRODUCERS THROUGH THE TENNESSEE SUSTAINABLE SPIRITS (TNSS) PROGRAM.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE GRANTEE IS EXPECTED TO REPORT ON THE PERFORMANCE MEASURES (OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES) AND NOTE WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AS WELL AS COMMIT TO FOLLOWING UP WITH FACILITIES TO FIND OUT WHETHER THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WAS ADOPTED AND IMPLEMENTED. SPECIFICALLY, THE GRANTEE ANTICIPATES PROVIDING THE FOLLOWING OUTPUTS: 6 WORKSHOPS; 12 WEBINARS; AT LEAST 15-30 NEW FACILITIES PARTICIPATING IN P2 WORKSHOPS; CONTINUED OPERATION AND EXPANSION OF TNSS PROGRAM. OUTCOME MEASURES INCLUDE AN ESTIMATED 32,000 TONS OF POLLUTION PREVENTED AND $20,000,000 SAVED. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT WILL BE THE MANUFACTURING COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT TENNESSEE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., INFORMATION, TRAINING, TOOLS) TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2). P2 MEANS REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POLLUTANTS FROM ENTERING ANY WASTE STREAM OR OTHERWISE BEING RELEASED INTO THE ENVIRONMENT PRIOR TO RECYCLING, TREATMENT, OR DISPOSAL. P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $349,994 TO EAST CAROLINA UNIVERSITY FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THAT AIMS TO REDUCE POLLUTION, CONSERVE WATER, AND SAVE ENERGY THROUGH LEAN AND GREEN PRACTICES IN NORTH CAROLINA MANUFACTURING.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGN WITH ONE OR MORE OF THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS). SPECIFICALLY, THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE 12 ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSESSMENTS FOR MANUFACTURES, 4 TECHNICAL TRAINING COURSES, 2 REGIONAL WORKSHOPS WITH A TOTAL OF 100-200 ATTENDEES FROM ABOUT 50 BUSINESSES, 2 CASE STUDIES, AND 4 WEBINARS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CONDUCTED BY THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT MANUFACTURING FACILITIES IN NORTH CAROLINA AND MAY ADDRESS UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THE GRANTEE IS EXPECTED TO REPORT ON P2 PERFORMANCE MEASURES (OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES) AND NOTE WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AS WELL AS COMMIT TO FOLLOWING-UP WITH FACILITIES TO FIND OUT WHETHER THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WAS ADOPTED AND IMPLEMENTED. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES AS A RESULT OF THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDED TO INDUSTRY ARE AN ESTIMATED REDUCTION OF 119,936.57 KG/YEAR OF CO2, 60 KG/YEAR OF CO, 600 KG/YEAR OF SO2, AND 210 KG/YEAR OF NOX. THE ESTIMATED REDUCTION OF WATER IN THE BEVERAGE INDUSTRY FACILITIES PROVIDED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IS 0.4 LITER OF WATER/LITER OF WINE AND 0.6 LITER OF WATER/LITER OF BEER. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE MANUFACTURING COMMUNITY IN NORTH CAROLINA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., INFORMATION, TRAINING, TOOLS) TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2). THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $350,000 TO THE KENTUCKY ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT CABINET TO SUPPORT THE KENTUCKY POLLUTION PREVENTION PARTNERSHIP. ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WILL USE A COMBINATION OF BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES IDENTIFICATION AND COMMUNICATION, ONSITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, TRAINING, AND THEMED ROUNDTABLES TO ACCOMPLISH ITS GOALS. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE 26 ONE-ON-ONE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDED TO KY BUSINESSES; 30 ADDITIONAL BRIEF TECHNICAL ASSISTANCES; 2 NEA SPECIFIC ROUNDTABLES; 2 KY EXCEL BEACON P2 AWARDS GIVEN; 2 WEBPAGES DEVELOPED; AND 24 ELECTRONIC MEDIA EXTENSIONS (BLOGS, NEWSLETTERS, ETC.). THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGN WITH ONE OR MORE OF THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS. SUBRECIPIENT:KENTUCKY POLLUTION PREVENTION CENTER'S (KPPC) SERVICES WILL BE AVAILABLE TO ANY KENTUCKY COMPANY WITHIN EPA P2 NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS #1 OR #3. KPPC WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, TOOLS AND INFORMATION THAT WILL ENHANCE THE COMPANY'S ABILITY TO IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES TO BASELINE, BENCHMARK AND CONTINUOUSLY MEASURE PROGRESS TOWARD GREENHOUSE GAS PREVENTION GOALS. ASSISTANCE MAY BE PROVIDED EITHER THROUGH EMAIL, CONFERENCE CALLING OR VIA GOTOMEETING TO ALLOW FOR INTERACTION WITH THE CLIENT. IN-PERSON COACHING VISITS AND ON-SITE ASSESSMENTS WILL BE PROVIDED ON A LIMITED BASIS IN RESPONSE TO THE NATURE AND SCOPE OF ASSISTANCE REQUESTED; INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: BASELINE ENERGY, WATER AND MATERIALS USAGE; DEVELOP SUSTAINABLE VALUE STREAM MAPS (SUS-VSM) AND MATERIAL/WATER BALANCE APPROACHES OF THEIR PROCESS; IDENTIFY AND QUANTIFY ENERGY, WATER AND MATERIALS USAGE RELATIVE TO THE SUS-VSM; AND IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES FOR ENERGY EFFICIENCY, WATER CONSERVATION AND MATERIALS USE REDUCTION. ADDITIONALLY, THE SUBAWARDEE, KPPC, WILL PROVIDE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS TO KY DEP AS A METHOD FOR MONITORING PROGRESS. OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES PROVIDING THE FOLLOWING OUTPUTS AND DELIVERABLES: 40 P2 PRACTICES IMPLEMENTED BY FACILITIES; 6 CASE STUDIES DEVELOPED; 1 P2 OUTREACH TOOLKIT DEVELOPED; 2,500 PEOPLE TRAINED/REACHED; 20 FACILITIES IN OR ADJACENT TO EJ COMMUNITIES REACHED; 4 WEBPAGES ENHANCED; AND 32 NEW KY EXCEL MEMBERS/KPPC CLIENTS. ESTIMATED ANTICIPATED ANNUAL ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOMES INCLUDE A REDUCTION OF 1,000 LBS. HAZARDOUS WASTE, 10,000 GALLONS OF WATER EFFLUENT, 12,000 MTCO2E, 750,000 GALLONS OF WATER, AND 40,000 MMBTU, AS WELL $367,875 SAVED FOR BUSINESSES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE KENTUCKY MANUFACTURERS IN THE FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURING AND PROCESSING AND THE AUTOMOTIVE MANUFACTURING AND MAINTENANCE SECTORS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2)).  THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $350,00 TO THE GEORGIA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY RESEARCH CORPORATION TO CONDUCT POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2) ASSESSMENTS, TARGETED TRAINING AND BEST PRACTICE TOOLS DELIVERED IN A COHORT MODEL TO TEACH GREEN PRINCIPLES TO GEORGIA MANUFACTURERSP2 MEANS REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POLLUTANTS FROM ENTERING ANY WASTE STREAM OR OTHERWISE BEING RELEASED INTO THE ENVIRONMENT PRIOR TO RECYCLING, TREATMENT, OR DISPOSAL.  P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.  SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WORK WILL PROVIDE P2 ASSESSMENTS TO HELP MANUFACTURERS UNDERSTAND THEIR CURRENT STATE AND IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADVANCING POLLUTION PREVENTION. TRAINING AND SUPPORT WILL ALSO HELP MANUFACTURERS UNDERSTAND THE FINANCIAL BENEFITS OF P2 AS THEY THRIVE IN A NEW BUSINESS ERA FOCUSED ON SUSTAINABILITY, AS WELL AS IDENTIFY THE TOOLS AND RESOURCES AVAILABLE TO THEM.ACTIVITIES:THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGN WITH ONE OR MORE OF THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS). SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT(S) WILL CONDUCT P2 ASSESSMENTS, TARGETED TRAINING AND BEST PRACTICE TOOLS DELIVERED IN A COHORT MODEL TO TEACH GREEN PRINCIPLES CONCENTRATING ON HAZARDOUS MATERIALS USE REDUCTION, GHG REDUCTION, ENERGY EFFICIENCY, AND WATER REDUCTION. THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE FACILITATING 4 COHORTS OF MANUFACTURERS IN THE FOOD AND BEVERAGE AS WELL AS THE METAL MANUFACTURING AND FABRICATION SECTORS. EACH COHORT WOULD CONSIST OF 6-8 ORGANIZATIONS FROM THE TARGET SECTOR. THE COHORT PROCESS WOULD TRAIN AND COACH PARTICIPANTS TO: IDENTIFY THE CURRENT STATE OF THEIR WASTE STREAMS, DISCHARGE, AND EMISSIONS; IDENTIFY AND IMPLEMENT WASTE STREAM MEASUREMENT PROGRAMS (P2 TOOLS); IMPLEMENT THE PROCESSES NEEDED TO REGULARLY QUANTIFY AND REPORT ON WASTE STREAMS, DISCHARGES, AND EMISSIONS IMPACTS; IDENTIFY AND PRIORITIZE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SOURCE REDUCTION; SET SOURCE REDUCTION OBJECTIVES; IMPLEMENT IDENTIFIED ACTIONS FOR SOURCE REDUCTION; MEASURE AND REGULARLY REPORT THE RESULTS OF REDUCTIONS; AND RECOGNIZE P2 SUCCESSES AND RENEW AND/OR SET NEW P2 OBJECTIVES (I.E., REPEAT STEPS 4-8).SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CONDUCTED BY THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT MANUFACTURING FACILITIES IN GEORGIA AND MAY ADDRESS UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THE GRANTEE IS EXPECTED TO REPORT ON P2 PERFORMANCE MEASURES (OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES) AND NOTE WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AS WELL AS COMMIT TO FOLLOWING-UP WITH FACILITIES TO FIND OUT WHETHER THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WAS ADOPTED AND IMPLEMENTED. SPECIFICALLY, IT IS THE AIM OF THIS PROJECT THAT COHORT PARTICIPANTS (4 COHORTS OF 6-8 ORGANIZATIONS PER COHORT) WOULD IDENTIFY AND IMPLEMENT AN AVERAGE OF A 10% REDUCTION IN BOTH HAZARDOUS MATERIAL USE AND HAZARDOUS EMISSIONS, 10% REDUCTION IN GHG EMISSIONS, AND A 10% REDUCTION IN WATER DISCHARGES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE MANUFACTURERS IN THE FOOD AND BEVERAGE AS WELL AS THE METAL MANUFACTURING AND FABRICATION SECTORS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $267,994 TO THE UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA TO SUPPORT POLLUTION PREVENTION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN ALABAMA UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA).  SPECIFICALLY, THE UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA WILL IMPLEMENT ITS OWN PROJECT TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THE ALABAMA BEVERAGE ASSOCIATION AND SEAFOOD PROCESSING PLANTS TO IMPLEMENT AND AMPLIFY BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES FOR SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOW AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2)). ACTIVITIES:PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: A SUSTAINABILITY AND P2 BEST PRACTICES WORKSHOP; ONE P2 CASE STUDY IN THE FOOD PROCESSING SECTOR; TWO STAKEHOLDER GROUP ENGAGEMENTS THAT SERVE TWO MAJOR INDUSTRIAL SECTORS; TWO VIRTUAL TRAINING TOOLS AND VIDEOS HOSTED ON THE UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA P2 PROGRAM WEBPAGE; FOUR ON-SITE TECHNICAL P2 ASSESSMENTS; FOUR TECHNICAL P2 ASSESSMENT REPORTS; FOUR P2 PROGRAM AND BEST PRACTICES PRESENTATIONS AT TRADE ASSOCIATION MEETINGS AND CONFERENCE; AND FOUR TECHNICAL ASSESSMENT FOLLOW-UPS THAT INCLUDE MONTHLY EMAILS, SIX-MONTH CONFERENCES, AND ANNUAL CONFERENCES CALLS OR ON-SITE MEETINGS.SUBRECIPIENT:THE SUBAWARD TO THE ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (ADEM) IN THE AMOUNT OF $51,000 WILL BROADEN THE EXISTING PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE RECIPIENT AND ADEM IN ORDER TO EXECUTE THIS MULTIMEDIA PROJECT WITH A FOCUS ON REDUCTION IN CHEMICAL USE, ENERGY SAVINGS, AND OVERALL P2 EFFORTS. THE SUBAWARD WILL SUPPORT FUNDS FOR ONE SENIOR ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEER AT ADEM WITH 35 YEARS OF PROCESS ENGINEERING EXPERIENCE TO HELP ACHIEVE EPA'S HIGH PERFORMANCE METRICS. THE ADEM ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEER WILL HELP CONDUCT THE FACILITY TECHNICAL ASSESSMENTS AND WILL HELP LEAD THE PRINCIPLE INVESTIGATOR SCHEDULE. HE WILL ALSO ASSIST THE PROJECT MANAGERS WITH PREPARATION OF FINAL P2 REPORTS AND CASE STUDIES.OUTCOMES:THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CONDUCTED BY THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT MANUFACTURING FACILITIES IN ALABAMA AND THE COMMUNITIES OF BAYOU LA BATRE AND THE ALABAMA BLACK BELT, WHICH ARE COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS. POTENTIAL YEARLY REDUCTIONS FROM ON-SITE ASSESSMENTS INCLUDE 0.5 MILLION GALLONS OF GROUNDWATER; 50,000 LBS FOOD PROCESSING WASTE; 20 TONS NUTRIENT LOADING TO RECEIVING STREAMS; VOCS AND HAPS IN AIR EMISSIONS BY 50%; ENERGY USE BY 5 TO 10%; HAZARDOUS WASTE GENERATION BY WAY OF MATERIAL SUBSTITUTION 50 TO 100%; AND 12,000 TONS OF CARBON DIOXIDE. THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES THAT AT LEAST 25% OF WORKSHOP AND EVENT ATTENDEES WILL ADOPT P2 BEST PRACTICES AT THEIR FACILITIES. FACILITY MODELS WILL BE DEVELOPED FOR P2 MEASURES ACROSS SEAFOOD, CATFISH, AND FOOD PROCESSING INDUSTRIES. P2 TRAINING NEEDS AND INTERESTS WILL BE IDENTIFIED AND CASE STUDY DEVELOPMENTS WILL BE EVALUATED.

IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (DEQ) WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BUSINESSES IN IDAHO IN SUPPORT OF NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS) 1, 3, 4, AND 5. DEQ WILL PARTNER WITH TECHHELP IDAHO TO EXPAND THE 'GREEN THE GREEN BELT' FOOD PROCESSING PROGRAM TO INCLUDE AEROSPACE MANUFACTURING. DEQ WILL ALSO CONDUCT OUTREACH TO ENCOURAGE THE ADOPTION OF WATER-BASED COATINGS AND LESS HAZARDOUS SOLVENTS IN THE AUTOMOTIVE MAINTENANCE SECTOR AND PROMOTE THE ADOPTION OF POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2) PRACTICES BY PRODUCING CASE STUDIES ON IDAHO COMPANIES THAT ARE ACTIVELY PRACTICING P2.

ODEQ WILL: 1. DELIVER INTERNSHIP PROGRAM TO PLACE STUDENTS WITH BUSINESSES FOR ON-SITE P2 RESEARCH.  2.  TRAIN STAFF AND BUSINESSES TO ASSESS/SELECT SAFER ALTERNATIVES AND SUPPORT P2 RESEARCH FOR THE SAFER CHEMICAL ALTERNATIVES AND P2 TRAINING/ASSESSMENT PROJECTS.  3. DELIVER PHASE II OF A TA PROGRAM FOR THE METALS OUTREACH INITIATIVE TO PROMOTE P2. 4. ENHANCE THE ECOBIZ PROGRAM TO RECOGNIZE BUSINESSES WHO HAVE ADOPTED P2 PRACTICES. OUTPUTS: 2 ONSITE P2 ASSESSMENTS, 4 CASE STUDIES, 5 ECOBIZ CERTIFIED BUSINESSES, 10 TRAININGS, 12 SUCCESS STORIES, 34 SITE VISITS, AND 34 P2 RECOMMENDATIONS

1) ASSIST FOOD PROCESSING INDUSTRY BY IDENTIFYING SAFER REFRIGERANTS, OPTIMIZING CLEANING-IN-PLACE SYSTEMS, AND MANAGING ACIDIC WASTEWATER 2) CONDUCT ENERGY AUDITS, ALTERNATIVE CLEANING PRODUCTS, AND GREEN MANUFACTURING CONSULTS 3) PILOT AN ALTERNATIVE BRAKE CLEANER PROGRAM AT REPAIR FACILITIES 4) CONDUCT GREEN CHEMISTRY AND SAFER CHOICE EDUCATION/PROMOTION TO AID DECISION-MAKERS 5) CONDUCT VIRTUAL REALITY PAINTING EFFICIENCY TRAINING. CASE STUDIES, ARTICLES IN ECOLOGY'S SHOPTALK NEWSLETTER/BLOG, AND ONE VIDEO SUCCESS STORY ARE PLANNED, ALONG WITH REQUIRED FACILITY-LEVEL REPORTING.

THE GREEN STAR PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND CONTINUED SUPPORT TO BUSINESSES WHO STRIVE TO ACCOMPLISH THE GREEN STAR AWARD AND CERTIFICATION INCLUDING BUSINESSES IN THE OIL/GAS SECTOR, MANUFACTURING, DRY CLEANERS, AUTOMOTIVE REPAIR AND PAINT SHOPS.   GREEN STAR WILL ALSO PROVIDE SOURCE REDUCTION /P2 TRAININGS AND WORKSHOPS. TOPICS INCLUDE TSCA PRIORITY OBJECTIVES IN THE OIL/GAS SECTOR, SOURCE REDUCTION TECHNIQUES FOR SEAFOOD PROCESSORS AND BREWERIES, AND SOURCE REDUCTION TECHNIQUES FOR HAZARDOUS MATERIALS REDUCTION FOR BUSINESSES ACROSS ALASKA.

DEQ WILL PROVIDE OUTREACH AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BUSINESSES IN SUPPORT OF CORE P2 PROGRAMS INCLUDING CLEAN AIR ZONE, IDAHO CHEMICAL ROUNDUP, AND THE IDAHO ENVIRONMENTAL GUIDE, TO ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH IMPACTS ASSOCIATED WITH AIR QUALITY, TSCA PRIORITY CHEMICALS, AND LOCAL P2 ISSUES. DEQ WILL PARTNER WITH TECHHELP, THE PACIFIC PPRC, THE UNIVERSITY OF IDAHO, AND BOISE STATE UNIVERSITY TO PROVIDE P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO FOOD AND BEVERAGE PROCESSERS AND TO ADDRESS POLLUTION GENERATED BY THE FOOD PROCESSING INDUSTRY AND OTHER MANUFACTURERS.

WDOE WILL PROVIDE TRAINING TO BUSINESSES IN MULTIPLE STATES ON SAFER CHEMICALS THROUGH AN OSHA/ECOLOGY COLLABORATION AND SUPPORT THE USE OF CHEMICAL HAZARD ASSESSMENTS IN ADVISING BUSINESSES AND PROMOTE THE USE OF SAFER CHOICE PRODUCTS. OPPORTUNITIES AT BUSINESSES FOR POLLUTION PREVENTION WILL BE IDENTIFIED DURING 'KATA' LEAN TRAINING AND ITS IMPLEMENTATION AS WELL AS DURING EXAMINATION OF A SUPPLY CHAIN. REGION 10 NEEDS EXPRESSED BY THOSE STATES' POLLUTION PREVENTION COORDINATORS ARE ALSO PLANNED, INCLUDING ANNUAL ROUNDTABLES AND SPRAY EFFICIENCY TRAININGS.

ODEQ WILL UNDERTAKE THREE P2 PROJECTS: 1) DELIVER AN INTERNSHIP PROGRAM THAT PLACES 14 PAID STUDENTS WITH BUSINESSES TO CONDUCT ON-SITE, P2 RESEARCH; 2) TRAIN OREGON AGENCY STAFF AND BUSINESSES ON SAFER ALTERNATIVES AND GREEN CHEMISTRY APPROACHES, AND SUPPORT REGIONAL SAFER CHEMICAL ALTERNATIVES TRAINING AND ASSESSMENT PILOTS; 3) DESIGN PHASE I OF A TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE OUTREACH PROGRAM -TOXICS REDUCTION OUTREACH INITIATIVE FOR METAL FINISHING, COATING AND MANUFACTURING, THAT WILL IDENTIFY CHEMICAL AND PROCESS ALTERNATIVES AND PROMOTE SOURCE REDUCTION.
WDOE WILL PROMOTE NATIONAL AND REGIONAL P2 STRATEGIES INCLUDING SPRAY PAINTERS TRAINING, AASSISTANCE TO P2 TA PROVIDERS AND P2 INTEGRATED PEST MANAGE
WDOE WILL PROVIDE POLLUTION PREVENTION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BUSINESSES INCUDING CHEMICAL HAZARD AND LEAN ASSESSMENTS.  WDOE WILL ALSO PROVIDE P2 G
GREEN CHEMISTRY RELATED PROJECTS TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BUSINESSES INCLUDING CONTINUING OREGON ECONCOMY, ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT (E3) TECH

THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, CONTINUED AND NEW SOURCE REDUCTION ACTIVITIES, AND CONTINUED MULTIMEDIA POLLUTION PREVENTION ACTIVITIES WITH NEW MEXICO BUSINESSES, MANUFACTURERS, AND COMMUNITIES, PRIMARILY IN THE FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURING NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREA (NEA), BUT EXTENDING TO ALL EPA NEAS.

LOUISIANA STATE UNIVERSITY WILL EXPAND LOUISIANA'S POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2) PROGRAM BY PARTNERING WITH MAJOR UNIVERSITIES AND LOCAL PARTNERS TO SUPPORT DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO MORE CHEMICAL, METAL, AND FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURERS IN LOUISIANA TO REDUCE POLLUTION IN OUR COMMUNITY WHILE ENHANCING BUSINESS PROFITABILITY.

THIS PROJECT WILL USE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING TO PROMOTE SOURCE REDUCTION THROUGH THE USE OF FOCUSED E3 ASSESSMENTS AND POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2) TECHNIQUES WITH PARTNERS IN EPA REGION 6.  THE PROPOSAL DESCRIBES A VARIETY OF APPROACHES TO PROMOTING SOURCE REDUCTION FOR BUSINESSES INCLUDING SITE VISITS, WORKSHOPS, DATA ANALYSIS TO DEVELOP BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, AND DISSEMINATION OF P2 PRACTICES THROUGH WEBSITE, PARTNERSHIPS AND CONFERENCES.

THIS PROJECT WILL HELP BUSINESSES ADOPT POLLUTION PREVENTION TECHNIQUES INTO DAY-TO-DAY OPERATIONS TO REDUCE OR ELIMINATE HARMFUL POLLUTANTS FROM ENTERING THE AIR, WATER OR LAND AND ENCOURAGE EDUCATION AND TRAINING IN POLLUTION PREVENTION SOURCE REDUCTION TECHNIQUES.

THE STATE OF ARKANSAS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2) PROGRAM WILL USE A MULTI-PRONGED APPROACH OF SITE-ASSISTANCE VISITS AND RECOGNITION PROGRAMS TO MOTIVATE BUSINESSES TO IMPROVE THE EFFICIENCY OF THEIR OPERATIONS, RESULTING IN CLEANER LAND, AIR, AND WATER FOR ARKANSAS.

VALUE LOUISIANA'S E3 PROGRAM HELPS MAKE FACILITIES MORE EFFICIENT AND COST EFFECTIVE BY OFFERING LEAN, GREEN AND CLEAN TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT TO IMPLEMENT A VARIETY OF EFFICIENCY AND SOURCE REDUCTION PROJECTS, INCLUDING WATER, ENERGY, SOLID WASTE, HAZARDOUS WASTE, PROCESS IMPROVEMENTS, AND MORE THAT WILL REDUCE COSTS AND WASTE.

THIS GRANT PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE NEW MEXICO STATE UNIVERSITY TO IMPLEMENT ITS OWN PROJECT TO CONTINUE MULTIMEDIA POLLUTION PREVENTION AND LEAN & GREEN ACTIVITIES WITH NM BUSINESSES, MANUFACTURERS, AND COMMUNITIES; CONTINUE 'E3' PROGRAM OUTREACH AND TRAINING WITH PARTNERS IN TX; CONTINUE P2 RECOGNITION AT NMSU/WERC ENVIRONMENTAL DESIGN CONTEST; AND NEW COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIPS WITH THE NEW MEXICO BREWERS GUILD AND THE BORDERPLEX ALLIANCE.
