THIS ACTION PROVIDES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $90,000 TO TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT & CONSERVATION TO PROVIDE WORKSHOPS, ROUND TABLES, AND SUPPORT TO TENNESSEE MANUFACTURERS TO ACHIEVE MEASURABLE RESULTS IN POLLUTION PREVENTION, GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS, AND ASSOCIATED COST SAVINGS AS WELL AS ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SPIRITS PRODUCERS THROUGH THE NEWLY FORMED TENNESSEE SUSTAINABLE SPIRITS PROGRAM.

THIS ACTION PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $44,000 TO CLEMSON UNIVERSITY TO  ESTABLISH A FOCUSED EFFORT ON POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2) IN THE EPA NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREA (NEA) #5: METAL MANUFACTURING AND FABRICATION. THE METHODS USED WILL BE A COMBINATION OF BEST PRACTICES, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND TRAINING ACHIEVED THROUGH MEETINGS, ON- AND OFF-SITE INTERACTIONS, AND PUBLICATIONS SUCH AS WHITE PAPERS AND CASE STUDIES.    .

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $90,000 TO EAST CAROLINA UNIVERSITY TO REDUCE POLLUTION, CONSERVE WATER, AND SAVE ENERGY THROUGH LEAN AND GREEN PRACTICES IN THE FOOD AND BEVERAGE PROCESSING, CHEMICAL MANUFACTURING, AND METAL MANUFACTURING AND FABRICATION INDUSTRIES IN NORTH CAROLINA.

THIS ACTION PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $90,000 TO SUPPORT THE NORTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY TO CONTINUE ITS ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP INITIATIVE TO PROVIDE PARTNERS WITH TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THAT WILL INCREASE THE KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE, AND EXPERTISE OF ITS MEMBERS.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $60,085 TO THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY TO CONDUCT WORKSHOPS THAT RECOGNIZES LEADERSHIP AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WITH A FOCUS ON AUTOMOTIVE, AREOSPACE AND METAL MANUFACTURING. THE PROJECT WILL WORK TO REDUCE SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTES, ENERGY AND WATER CONCUMPTION AND DISCHARGES TO AIR AND WATER.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $90,000 TO GEORGIA TECH RESEARCH COORPORATION TO SUPPORT THEIR PARTNERSHIP FOR A SUSTAINABLE GEORGIA (PSG) WHICH IS A COORDINATED FEDERAL AND LOCAL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE INITIATIVE THAT HELPS GEORGIA MANUFACTURING COMMUNITIES IN THE FOOD AND AUTOMOTIVE SECTORS ADAPT AND THRIVE IN A NEW BUSINESS ERA FOCUSED ON SUSTAINABILITY.

THIS ACTION PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $31,000 TO SUPPORT THE UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA IN THEIR PROJECT WHICH INCLUDES TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOLLOW-UPS AND WORKSHOP TRAINING FOR FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF ALABAMA.

DESCRIPTION:THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL CENTER AROUND DEVELOPING A COLLABORATIVE OF PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTOR ENTITIES LED BY UIC AND THE CITY OF CHICAGO THAT WOULD FOCUS ON STRATEGIC ENERGY AND POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2) MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, PROVIDING MANUFACTURING BUSINESSES IN FIVE (5) IDENTIFIED NEAS WITH EDUCATIONAL AND TRAINING RESOURCES, SHARING OF BEST PRACTICES, PROVIDING ONE-ON-ONE CLIMATE STRATEGY SOLUTIONS, CONNECTIONS TO UTILITY AND FEDERAL STRATEGIC ENERGY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS, AND PROVIDING PEER-TO-PEER NETWORKING OPPORTUNITIES WITH THE GOAL OF INCREASING THE ADOPTION OF P2 CONCEPTS AND TECHNOLOGIES IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.ACTIVITIES:UIC, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE CITY OF CHICAGO, WILL COORDINATE ACTIVITIES WITH THE ELECTRIC AND NATURAL GAS INVESTOR-OWNED UTILITIES OF COMMONWEALTH EDISON (COMED) AND PEOPLES GAS (PG), INDUSTRY TRADE ASSOCIATIONS, AND EPA REGION 5 TO TARGET THE FIVE NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS)  BY PROVIDING THEM TECHNICAL EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE ON STRATEGIC ENERGY AND P2 MANAGEMENT PRACTICES THAT SUPPORT THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL GOALS OF CARBON/EMISSIONS REDUCTION, DECARBONIZATION, SUSTAINABILITY, ELECTRIFICATION, AND NET-ZERO.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:UIC AND THE CITY OF CHICAGO, ALONG WITH ITS PARTNERS OF COMED AND PEOPLES GAS, AND WORKING IN CONJUNCTION WITH EPA REGION 5 AND RELEVANT TRADE ASSOCIATIONS, ARE ALL DEEPLY COMMITTED TO PROVIDING NEEDED EDUCATION ON DEVELOPING TAILORED POLLUTION PREVENTION STRATEGIES, RECOMMENDATIONS, AND INTERVENTIONS IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.  UIC AND THE CITY OF CHICAGO WILL DEVELOP A COLLABORATIVE OF NEAS EACH YEAR, TARGETING NEAS IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, THAT WILL PROVIDE: EDUCATION ON THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS THEIR FACILITIES HAVE ON THEIR SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES, TARGETED STRATEGIES TO IMPROVE THEIR FACILITY'S ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITY, SHARING OF BEST PRACTICES AND LESSONS LEARNED AMONGST NEA PEERS, EDUCATION ON THE STATE OF ILLINOIS' AND CITY OF CHICAGO'S CLEAN ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL POLICIES, AND COLLECTIVE STRATEGIES HOW TO IMPROVE THE ENVIRONMENTAL BURDENS IN THESE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THE ILLINOIS CONSERVATION OF RESOURCES AND ENERGY (ICORE) PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO TWENTY-FIVE ILLINOIS MANUFACTURING AND PROCESSING FACILITIES ACROSS MULTIPLE BUSINESS SECTORS, COMPRISING NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS  #1 - 5. IMPLEMENTATION OF P2 RECOMMENDATIONS FROM ASSISTANCE WILL BE MEASURED AND REPORTED, RESULTING IN REDUCED ENERGY, WATER USE, HAZARDOUS MATERIALS GENERATION AND BUSINESS COSTS AT FACILITIES.ACTIVITIES:ICORE WILL SPECIFICALLY FOCUS ON PROVIDING POLLUTION PREVENTION ASSISTANCE TO ILLINOIS MANUFACTURERS AND PROCESSORS IN THE UPCOMING 2-YEAR FUNDING PERIOD. TWO CASE STUDIES WILL BE DEVELOPED AND PUBLISHED ON THE ISTC WEBSITE AND PROMOTED THROUGH ISTC'S NEWSLETTER AND SOCIAL MEDIA CHANNELS, NPPR, THE P2TECH EMAIL LIST, AND THE ASSOCIATED EPA RESOURCE NETWORKS FOR THE PURPOSE OF DISSEMINATING P2 PRACTICES OR INNOVATIVE TECHNOLOGIES, ENABLING OTHER P2 ASSISTANCE PROVIDERS OR INTERESTED BUSINESSES TO LEARN FROM AND REPLICATE THOSE P2 PRACTICES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THERE ARE APPROXIMATELY 23,700 COMPANIES WITHIN THESE DESIGNATED SECTORS IN ILLINOIS.  ICORE WILL TARGET FACILITIES THAT ARE IN OR ADJACENT TO COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS (BY BLOCK GROUP) AS WELL AS COMMUNITIES WITH UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS. ICORE WILL PRIORITIZE RURAL AREAS OF ILLINOIS. CLOSE ATTENTION WILL BE PAID TO UNDERSERVED AREAS SUCH AS EAST ST. LOUIS METRO, GREATER ALTON, CAIRO, CARBONDALE, ROCK ISLAND, FREEPORT AND ROCKFORD.

DESCRIPTION:THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO HELP BUSINESSES IN THE AUTOMOTIVE MANUFACTURING SECTOR IMPROVE THEIR COMPETITIVENESS THROUGH P2 PRACTICES. TO THIS PURPOSE, ON-SITE P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WILL BE PROVIDED TO SELECTED BUSINESSES LOCATED IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN CENTRAL MICHIGAN. MOREOVER, A TRAINING (BUSINESS SUSTAINABILITY THROUGH P2) AND A ROUNDTABLE (COMMUNITY-BASED P2) WILL BE ORGANIZED. DUE TO HISTORIC AND CURRENT HEAVY MANUFACTURING ACTIVITIES AS WELL AS THE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE (EJ) CONCERNS IN THE PROJECT REGION, THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL BUILD UPON LOCAL AND STATE EFFORTS AND INVOLVE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND BUSINESS GROUPS TO PROMOTE SUSTAINABILITY THROUGH P2.ACTIVITIES:THE PROPOSED PROJECT ACTIVITIES (ON-SITE P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING, BUSINESS SUSTAINABILITY THROUGH P2 TRAINING, AND COMMUNITY-BASED P2 ROUNDTABLES) WILL BE CONDUCTED WITH SELECTED BUSINESSES AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS THAT ARE LOCATED IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN CENTRAL MICHIGAN REGION. THE FACILITIES TO BE INVITED TO THE P2 TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES IN THIS PROJECT WERE ALREADY IDENTIFIED BY USING THE P2 ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE (EJ) FACILITY MAPPING TOOL (FIGURE 3 OF THE APPROVED WORKPLAN). AS CAN BE SEEN FROM FIGURE 3, THE PROJECT AREA IS CHARACTERIZED WITH 'LOW INCOME' (80-100 U.S. PERCENTILES), 'LESS THAN HS EDUCATION' (50-90 U.S. PERCENTILES), AND 'LINGUISTICALLY ISOLATED' (50-80 U.S. PERCENTILES). THE FACILITIES IN THE AUTOMOTIVE MANUFACTURING AND MAINTENANCE SECTOR (NEA #3) ARE LOCATED IN REGIONS WHICH HAVE CONSIDERABLY HIGH 'DEMOGRAPHIC INDEX' (PERCENTILE OF THE CENSUS BLOCK GROUP BASED ON THE AVERAGE OF PERCENT PEOPLE OF COLOR AND PERCENT LOW INCOME) BASED ON BOTH U.S. OR STATE PERCENTILES (FIGURE 3 OF THE APPROVED WORKPLAN). SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES FOR THE PROPOSED PROJECT ARE AS FOLLOWS, BUT NOT LIMITED TO: OUTPUTS:  1)NUMBER OF FACILITIES IN OR ADJACENT TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES TO BE PROVIDED WITH P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE = 3; 2)PERCENTAGE OF FACILITIES PROVIDED P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THAT THE GRANTEE FOLLOWS-UP WITH (E.G., PHONE CALL, VISIT, LETTER, OR EMAIL) TO DETERMINE WHICH P2 PRACTICES WERE IMPLEMENTED = 100%; 3)PERCENTAGE OF FACILITIES IN OR ADJACENT TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES THAT IMPLEMENTED AT LEAST ONE NEW P2 PRACTICE AS A RESULT OF THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY THE GRANTEE = GE; 67%; 4)NUMBER OF CASE STUDIES AND OTHER P2 DOCUMENTATION PRODUCTS DESCRIBING SPECIFIC P2 BEST PRACTICES IDENTIFIED, DEVELOPED, OR IMPLEMENTED THROUGH THE GRANT = GE; 2; AND 5)NUMBER OF AMPLIFICATION ACTIVITIES (I.E., TRAINING, WEBINARS, VIDEOS, OTHER OUTREACH) THAT WIDELY SHARE P2 PRACTICES AND P2 DOCUMENTATION PRODUCTS = 4
OUTCOMES: 1)REDUCTION IN POUNDS OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS USED AND OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES, POLLUTANTS AND CONTAMINANTS RELEASED AT FACILITIES IN OR ADJACENT TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES =GE; 5,000; 2)REDUCTIONS IN METRIC TONS OF CARBON DIOXIDE EQUIVALENT (MTCO2E) RESULTING FROM P2 ACTIONS IMPLEMENTED AT FACILITIES IN OR ADJACENT TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES =GE; 10,000; 3)REDUCTIONS IN GALLONS OF WATER USED AT FACILITIES IN OR ADJACENT TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES = GE; 100,000; AND 4)THE DOLLAR SAVINGS ASSOCIATED WITH IMPLEMENTING P2 ACTIONS AT FACILITIES IN OR ADJACENT TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES = GE; 150,000. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE UNDESERVED COMMUNITIES IN CENTRAL MICHIGAN.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON DEFINING CURRENT POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2) OPPORTUNITIES FOR PFAS WITHIN THE METAL MANUFACTURING AND FABRICATION, FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURING AND PROCESSING, AND CHEMICAL MANUFACTURING, PROCESSING AND FORMULATION INDUSTRIES TO PREVENT PFAS POLLUTION AND LIMIT PFAS EXPOSURE FROM FOOD. THE FOCUS WILL BE TO SHARE SOURCE REDUCTION STRATEGIES AND SUPPORT BUSINESSES AS THEY SEEK TO IMPLEMENT POLLUTION PREVENTION OPPORTUNITIES TO REDUCE OR ELIMINATE PFAS FROM THEIR PROCESSES AND PRODUCTS. IN ADDITION, THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO PROVIDE SECTOR SPECIFIC ASSESSMENT GUIDES TO ASSIST INDUSTRY LEADERS IN PROACTIVELY EVALUATING THEIR OPERATIONS FOR POSSIBLE PFAS USES AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR REDUCTION OR REPLACEMENT.ACTIVITIES:THE PROJECT PLAN SEEKS TO DEVELOP BASELINE UNDERSTANDING AND EXPERTISE IN PFAS THROUGH SEVERAL METHODS BEGINNING WITH IN-DEPTH LITERATURE REVIEWS. USING KNOWLEDGE GAINED IN THE FIRST PHASE OF THE STUDY, THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP AN INFORMATIONAL INTERVIEW STRATEGY, DEFINE CRITICAL P2 AND SUSTAINABILITY TARGETS IN THE SELECTED NEA INDUSTRIES, CONDUCT SITE ASSESSMENTS FOCUSED ON IDENTIFIED IMPROVEMENT OPPORTUNITIES, FOLLOW UP WITH FACILITIES TO MOTIVATE IMPLEMENTATION OF RECOMMENDATIONS AND DEVELOP SECTOR SPECIFIC ASSESSMENT GUIDES TO BE SHARED WITH INDUSTRY. KEY TASKS INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING.

TASK 1 - DEFINE KEY P2 OPPORTUNITIES FOR PFAS REDUCTION
TASK 2 - CONDUCT POLLUTION PREVENTION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WITH SELECTED SITES
TASK 3 - DEVELOP AND SHARE AN ASSESSMENT GUIDE FOR PFAS IDENTIFICATION BY SITE/SECTOR
TASK 4 - CONDUCT FOLLOW UP ACTIVITIES WITH ASSESSMENT FACILITIES
TASK 5 - ASSESS THE PROJECT PERFORMANCE AGAINST OBJECTIVES AND REPORT RESULTS TO SPONSORS AND PARTNERS
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE OR ELIMINATE THE USE AND RELEASE OF PFAS AND THE POLLUTION THEY CREATE THROUGH IDENTIFICATION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF SAFER ALTERNATIVES. THIS PROJECT WILL USE LITERATURE REVIEWS, DATA ANALYSIS, AND INCORPORATE SUCCESSFUL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES DEVELOPED BY POLLUTION PREVENTION ASSISTANCE PROVIDERS IN OTHER STATES TO IDENTIFY AREAS OF FOCUS FOR POTENTIAL SOURCE REDUCTION TECHNIQUES AND OPTIONS. INFORMATIONAL INTERVIEWS WITH INDUSTRY WILL PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES TO DISCERN WHAT GENERAL KNOWLEDGE SITES MAY HAVE ABOUT PFAS AND MAY IDENTIFY POTENTIAL APPLICATIONS FOR PFAS SOURCE REPLACEMENT AND/OR REDUCTION. PROVIDERS WILL DEVELOP TARGETED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE OUTREACH FOR SITE SPECIFIC ASSESSMENTS TO REDUCE OR ELIMINATE THE RELEASE OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS AND THE POLLUTION THEY CREATE THROUGH IDENTIFICATION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF OPTIMAL WORK PROCESSES AND SAFER ALTERNATIVES. ADDITIONAL OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, HAZARDOUS MATERIALS REDUCED, WATER EFFLUENT REDUCED, WATER CONSERVATION, MTCO2E ELIMINATED AND CREATION OF BUSINESS EFFICIENCIES. FORECASTS OF ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOMES WERE MADE BY STAFF AND STAKEHOLDERS EVALUATING PAST SIMILAR PROJECTS UNDERTAKEN ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS.

DESCRIPTION:POLLUTION PREVENTION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM FOR CHICAGO-BASED INDUSTRIAL FACILITIES IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES TO REDUCE IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE: THE GRANTEE WILL PROVIDE ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO 20 INDUSTRIAL PLANTS IN CHICAGO WITH AN EMPHASIS ON FACILITIES IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. UIC WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE UTILIZING EPA P2 BEST PRACTICES AND TOOLS TO FIND AND ACHIEVE ENERGY AND COST SAVINGS, EMISSIONS REDUCTION, AND WASTE REDUCTION FOR INDUSTRIAL PLANTS. UIC WILL PARTNER WITH THE CITY OF CHICAGO, WHO WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE IN TWO WAYS: 1) IDENTIFY POTENTIAL SITES IN UNDERSERVICED COMMUNITIES WHO ARE IN NEED OF TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE; AND 2) LEVERAGE CITY FUNDING AND RESOURCES TO HELP FUND AND IMPLEMENT PROJECTS IDENTIFIED DURING ASSESSMENTS. AT LEAST FOUR CASE STUDIES WILL BE DEVELOPED BASED ON FACILITIES THAT HAVE ADOPTED P2 TECHNOLOGIES.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: 
CREATION OF EPA MATERIALS, PROTOCOL, AND REPORT TEMPLATES FOR ASSESSMENTS; STAFF TRAINING; COMPLETE TECHNICAL ASSESSMENTS; DELIVERY OF SEMI-ANNUAL REPORTS TO EPA; IMPLEMENTATION TOOLKIT; IMPLEMENTATION FOLLOW UP; COMPLETE A CASE STUDY; DELIVERY OF FINAL PROGRAM REPORT TO EPA: UIC HAS ACCOUNTED FOR THE FACT THAT IMPLEMENTATION REPORTING MAY GO BEYOND THE END OF THE ALLOTTED PROGRAM CYCLE; UIC PROPOSES A TIMELINE FOR ALL ACTIVITIES AND DELIVERABLES (SEE APPROVED WORKPLAN); AND UIC BELIEVES THE PROPOSED TIMELINE IS REASONABLE AND ALLOWS FOR THE DELIVERY OF MOST DELIVERABLES AND OBJECTIVES BY THE END OF THE PROJECT, AND ACCOUNTS FOR IMPLEMENTATION WHICH MAY REQUIRE TIME BEYOND THE GRANT CYCLE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:UIC WILL UTILIZE A VARIETY OF APPROACHES TO MEASURE AND REPORT THE FOLLOWING DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:
UIC WILL MEASURE WATER USAGE DATA FOR THE PAST YEAR TO CREATE A BENCHMARK. UIC WILL WORK WITH THE CLIENTS AND MEASURE UTILITY BILLS BY ASSESSING PAYMENTS FOR THE PAST YEAR TO CREATE A BENCHMARK. UIC AND ITS PARTNERS WILL MEASURE A PARTICIPANT'S ENERGY USAGE DATA FOR THE PAST YEAR TO CREATE A BENCHMARK. UIC ESTIMATES THAT THE SMALL-TO-MEDIUM SIZED NEA FACILITIES RECEIVING P2 TECHNICAL ASSESSMENTS WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS BY 15-20% PER FACILITY, RANGING BETWEEN 380 AND 7,000 MTCO2 EQUIVALENT REDUCTIONS PER FACILITY, AND REPRESENTING A PROGRAM IMPACT OF 7,600 TO 140,000 MTCO2 EQUIVALENT REDUCTIONS OVER THE NEXT 5 YEARS. THE INTEDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE CITY OF CHICAGO.

DESCRIPTION:THIS INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., INFORMATION, TRAINING, TOOLS) TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2)). P2 MEANS REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POLLUTANTS FROM ENTERING ANY WASTE STREAM OR OTHERWISE BEING RELEASED INTO THE ENVIRONMENT PRIOR TO RECYCLING, TREATMENT, OR DISPOSAL. P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. 

ACTIVITIES:THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGN WITH ONE OR MORE OF THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS).  SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT(S) WILL ADDRESS THE FOLLOWING:

COMPLETE 6 TECHNICAL ASSESSMENTS TO TEST  CHECKLIST MEASURES
RECRUIT FACILITIES TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES TO PARTICIPATE IN GREEN BUSINESS CERTIFICATION
EXPAND P2 PRACTICE ADOPTION THROUGH BUSINESS TRAININGS AND RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT


SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CONDUCTED BY THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT FACILITIES AND, IF APPLICABLE, MAY ADDRESS UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THE GRANTEE IS EXPECTED TO REPORT ON P2 PERFORMANCE MEASURES (OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES) AND NOTE WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AS WELL AS COMMIT TO FOLLOWING-UP WITH FACILITIES TO FIND OUT WHETHER THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WAS ADOPTED AND IMPLEMENTED.

DESCRIPTION:THE ILLINOIS SUSTAINABLE TECHNOLOGY CENTER (ISTC) PROPOSES TO PROVIDE OFF-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THROUGH TRAINING AND DISSEMINATING P2 BEST PRACTICES THAT OTHERS CAM REPLICATE.  DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WILL BE PROVIDED TO 15 ILLINOIS MANUFACTURING AND PROCESSING FACILITIES ACROSS MULTIPLE BUSINESS SECTORS WHICH WILL RESULT IN REDUCED ENERGY AND WATER USE, HAZARDOUS MATERIALS USE AND GENERATION, AND REDUCED BUSINESS COSTS.ACTIVITIES:THE GRANTEE WILL PROVIDE TWO TRAINING EVENTS, AN ASSOCIATED POLLUTION PREVENTION GUIDEBOOK, AND ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO 15 ILLINOIS MANUFACTURING AND PROCESSING FACILITIES ACROSS MULTIPLE BUSINESS SECTORS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AND DELIVER TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO 15 ILLINOIS BUSINESSES AND ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE STATE SEEKING INFORMATION ABOUT SOURCE REDUCTION OPPORTUNITIES, TO PROVIDE ON-SITE TECHNICAL ADVICE TO BUSINESSES, TO ASSIST IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOURCE REDUCTION PLANS,; AND TO PROVIDE TRAINING IN SOURCE REDUCTION TECHNIQUES.

THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT, GREAT LAKES AND ENERGY (MICHIGAN DEGLE) PROJECT WILL  PROVIDE POLLUTION PREVENTION AND WASTE REDUCTION TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE INDUSTRIES AND BUSINESSES. THIS WORK WILL BE CONDUCTED THROUGH ONSITE AND OFFSITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, TRAININGS, PASS THROUGH GRANTS, AND WEBBASED TOOLS.

THE GRANTEE WILL SUPPORT THE FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURING SECTOR BY REDUCING THE END-USE ENERGY CONSUMPTION, SOURCE FUEL REQUIREMENTS, AND GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS ASSOCIATED WITH THE MANUFACTURE OF FROZEN FOODSTUFFS. THE GRANTEE WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ASSESS THE PERFORMANCE OF LOW- TEMPERATURE FREEZING SYSTEMS IN OPERATING FOOD PLANTS, CULTIVATE STRATEGIES TO IMPROVE THEIR PERFORMANCE, AND DISSEMINATE COST-EFFECTIVE APPROACHES TO INCREASE FREEZING SYSTEM ENERGY EFFICIENCY.

THE GRANTEE WILL EXPAND SUCCESSFUL POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2) ACTIVITIES FOR BUSINESSES ALIGNED WITH EACH OF THE FIVE NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREA (NEA) SECTORS BY CREATING AND DISTRIBUTING CATEGORY-SPECIFIC P2 SUCCESS STORIES AND P2 BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES BASED ON ACTUAL EXPERIENCES AND DATA COLLECTED FROM ORGANIZATIONS PARTICIPATING IN OHIO EPA'S ENCOURAGING ENVIRONMENTAL EXCELLENCE RECOGNITION PROGRAM. OHIO EPA WILL FURTHER BRING TOGETHER PARTICIPATING BUSINESSES TO SHARE THEIR SUCCESS STORIES IN PERSON WITH OTHER BUSINESSES, INCLUDING THOSE IN THEIR NEA CATEGORY. OHIO EPA WILL ALSO USE THIS PROJECT TO EXPAND AND IMPROVE ITS ON-SITE P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM.

THE ILLINOIS CONSERVATION OF RESOURCES AND ENERGY (ICORE) PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THIRTY (30) ILLINOIS MANUFACTURING AND PROCESSING FACILITIES ACROSS MULTIPLE BUSINESS SECTORS, COMPRISING THE NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS #1 ' 5.  IMPLEMENTATION OF POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2) RECOMMENDATIONS FROM ASSISTANCE WILL BE MEASURED AND REPORTED, RESULTING IN REDUCED ENERGY AND WATER USE, HAZARDOUS MATERIALS GENERATION AND REDUCED BUSINESS COSTS AT THE FACILITIES.

THE INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (IDEM) WILL IDENTIFY TOXIC REDUCTIONS IN 15 FACILITIES IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE PURDUE MANUFACTURING EXTENSION PARTNERSHIP. THE WASTE STREAM MAPPING PROCESS WILL BE USED TO IDENTIFY WASTE AND P2 OPPORTUNITIES AT INDUSTRIAL FACILITIES, INCLUDING TRI FACILITIES.

UWM WILL TARGET 10 FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURING FACILITIES WITH AMMONIA REFRIGERATION SYSTEMS IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE INDUSTRIAL REFRIGERATION CONSORTIUM. FIVE (5) CANDIDATE SITES WILL BE SELECTED TO IDENTIFY AND REDUCE AMMONIA LEAKAGE FROM INDUSTRIAL REFRIGERATION SYSTEMS. THE GRANTEE WILL DEVELOP A GUIDANCE DOCUMENT DETAILING METHODS FOR CALCULATING AMMONIA INVENTORY IN REAL-TIME (TO DETECT LEAKS) AND BEST PRACTICES FOR IDENTIFYING AND ELIMINATING FUGITIVE LEAKS. A WEBINAR WILL BE PROVIDED TO AMPLIFY BEST PRACTICES.

IMPLEMENTATION OF RECOMMENDATIONS FROM THE ASSESSMENTS WILL BE SUPPORTED AND MEASURED, RESULTING IN REDUCED: WATER AND ENERGY USAGE; HAZARDOUS MATERIALS GENERATION AND BUSINESS COSTS AT THE MANUFACTURING FACILITIES.

THE UNIVERSITY OF TOLEDO PARTNERSHIP WITH THE CENTER FOR INNOVATIVE FOOD TECHNOLOGIES, WILL: 1) PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THIRTY (30) FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURERS; 2) PROVIDE TWO SEMINAR TRAINING PROGRAMS IN SOURCE REDUCTION TECHNIQUES TO OHIO MANUFACTURERS; AND 3) ASSIST THE OHIO STATEWIDE ENVIRONMENTAL NETWORK (OSEN) TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE POLLUTION PREVENTION PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION EFFORTS STATEWIDE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., INFORMATION, TRAINING, TOOLS) TO BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND ADOPT SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES (ALSO KNOWN AS POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2)). P2 MEANS REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POLLUTANTS FROM ENTERING ANY WASTE STREAM OR OTHERWISE BEING RELEASED INTO THE ENVIRONMENT PRIOR TO RECYCLING, TREATMENT, OR DISPOSAL. P2 PRACTICES CAN HELP BUSINESSES SAVE MONEY BY REDUCING THEIR RESOURCE USE, EXPENDITURES, WASTE AND LIABILITY COSTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REDUCING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT AND HELPING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL WORK TO REDUCE PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES (PFAS) AND MICROPLASTICS CONTAMINATION IN FOOD AND FOOD WASTE STREAMS BY WORKING WITH VERMONT FOOD PROCESSORS TO EVALUATE CURRENT PACKAGING, GENERATE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR INCREASED SUSTAINABILITY IN PACKAGING AND EVALUATE THE TRANSPORT OF THESE PERSISTENT, BIO ACCUMULATIVE AND TOXIC SUBSTANCES IN FOOD WASTE AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THE PROJECT WILL EVALUATE AND CHARACTERIZE PFAS AND MICROPLASTICS CONCENTRATIONS WITHIN THE FOOD SYSTEM;  IDENTIFY SPECIFIC SOURCES OF CONTAMINATION AT PARTICIPATING BUSINESSES; RESEARCH, IDENTIFY, DEVELOP AND PROMOTE POLLUTION PREVENTION PRACTICES AND TOOLS TO REDUCE THE OCCURRENCE AND RELEASE OF PFAS AND  MICROPLASTICS FROM PACKAGING USED BY FOOD MANUFACTURERS; DISSEMINATE FINDINGS FROM RESEARCH; AND RECOMMEND CONTAMINANT SOURCE REDUCTION STRATEGIES THAT WILL BE REPLICATED AT BUSINESSES ACROSS THE STATE.  ALL FINDINGS, STRATEGIES AND TOOLS DEVELOPED WILL BE SHARED BROADLY.  ACTIVITIES:THE PRIORITIES FOR P2 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND TOOLS) ALIGN WITH ONE OR MORE OF THE PROGRAM'S NATIONAL EMPHASIS AREAS (NEAS).  SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON BUSINESSES WITHIN THE FOOD AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURING SECTOR (NEA 1) TO ADDRESS THEIR CONTRIBUTION OF PFAS AND MICROPLASTICS TO ORGANICS STREAMS AND THE ENVIRONMENT VIA CONTAMINATION FROM PACKAGING.  MULTIPLE POLLUTION PREVENTION APPROACHES WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE BUSINESSES WITH INFORMATION ON IDENTIFICATION, ALTERNATIVES AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS OF PFAS AND MICROPLASTICS.  THE SPECIFICS FOR EACH BUSINESS WILL VARY.  THE GRANTEE INTENDS TO UTILIZE ON-SITE AND OFF-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND PROVIDE INTRODUCTORY TRAININGS TO ALL INTERESTED FOOD AND BEVERAGE BUSINESSES TO EDUCATE ON THE CONTAMINANTS OF CONCERN. THIS PROJECT WILL USE POLLUTION PREVENTION SOURCE REDUCTION TOOLS AND STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS THE REDUCTION OF PER-AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES IN WASTEWATER GENERATED FROM BUSINESSES OF THE AEROSPACE PRODUCT AND PARTS MANUFACTURING AND MAINTENANCE AND METAL MANUFACTURING AND FABRICATION INDUSTRIES IN VERMONT.  THE GOAL IS TO REDUCE THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT OF THESE PERSISTENT BIOACCUMULATIVE TOXIC SUBSTANCES IN RECEIVING WATERS, GROUNDWATER AND SOILS BY IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF WASTEWATER EFFLUENT AND BIOSOLIDS PRODUCED AT PUBLICLY OWNED TREATMENT WORKS. THE GRANTEE WILL HELP BUSINESSES TO IDENTIFY SOURCES OF PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES IN THEIR PROCESSES AND REDUCE CONTRIBUTIONS TO PUBLICLY OWNED TREATMENT WORKS BY IMPLEMENTING POLLUTION PREVENTION SOURCE REDUCTION STRATEGIES SPECIFIC TO EACH FACILITY.

GOALS OF THE PROJECT INCLUDE PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO REDUCE WATER USE IN MANUFACTURING AND REDUCE WASTEWATER DISCHARGES LEADING TO A REDUCTION OF BIOCHEMICAL OXYGEN DEMAND, TOTAL SUSPENDED SOLIDS, ACIDIC AND BASIC PH, AND PHOSPHORUS TO PUBLICLY OWNED TEATMENT WORKS. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO REDUCE ENERGY USE VIA PARTNERSHIPS WITH THE STATE'S ELECTRICITY SUPPLIER AND AN ENERGY AUDITING FIRM, REDUCE USAGE OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS IN CLEANING OPERATIONS, AND USE WEBINARS, TRAININGS AND ROUNDTABLES TO AMPLIFY THIS WORK WITHIN THE BREWERY, WINERY AND DISTILLERY COMMUNITY IN RHODE ISLAND.

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE POLLUTION PREVENTION (P2) TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO MEDIUM TO LARGE SIZED BUSINESSES THROUGHOUT CONNECTIUT THAT MANUFACTURE OR PROCESS FOODS AND BEVERAGES. THE FOCUS WILL BE ON USING SOURCE REDUCTION TECHNIQUES TO REDUCE THE ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT OF THESE BUSINESSES. CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL USE ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO REDUCE ENERGY AND WATER USE AND WATER DISCHARGES AND TO ELIMINATE HAZARDOUS CHEMICALS IN THE MANUFACTURING PROCESSES. IN ADDITION, CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL OFFER OFF-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BUSINESSES, TEACH SOURCE REDUCTION CONCEPTS THROUGH ROUNDTABLES, MEETINGS AND WEBINARS AND DEVELOP WRITTEN ASSISTANCE MATERIALS. THESE MATERIALS, AS WELL AS BEST PRACTICES IDENTIFIED DURING ON- AND OFF-SITE ASSISTANCE, WILL BE DISSEMINATED WIDELY SO THAT ADDITIONAL BUSINESSES AND OTHER STATES CAN BENEFIT FROM THEM.

THE VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION (VTDEC) WILL USE THE VERMONT GREEN BUSINESS PROGRAM AND THE GOVERNOR'S AWARDS FOR ENVIRONMENTAL EXCELLENCE TO CONDUCT POLLUTION PREVENTION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, PROMOTE HAZARDOUS WASTE SOURCE REDUCTION, AND LEVERAGE VTDEC RESOURCES TO ADDRESS LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES. THE VERMONT GREEN BUSINESS PROGRAM WILL FOCUS ON PROVIDING POLLUTION PREVENTION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SUPPORT MORE SUSTAINABLE PRODUCTION AND PROMOTE HAZARDOUS MATERIALS SOURCE REDUCTION AT BREWERIES AND SPECIALTY FOOD MANUFACTURERS. VTDEC WILL ALSO ASSIST VALUE-ADDED DAIRY PRODUCTS PROCESSORS WITH ON-SITE ASSESSMENTS, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND PROCESS IMPROVEMENTS TO PREVENT POLLUTION AT ITS SOURCE. THESE PROJECTS WILL PROVIDE FOCUSED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BUSINESSES, PROVIDE ON-SITE VISITS AND ADVICE, TARGET BUSINESSES FOR WHOM A LACK OF INFORMATION AND EXPERTISE IS AN IMPEDIMENT TO SOURCE REDUCTION, AND OFFER TRAINING IN SOURCE REDUCTION TECHNIQUES.

USME WILL PROVIDE ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO AT LEAST FIVE BREWERIES TO IDENTIFY AND DEVELOP POLLUTION PREVENTION SOURCE REDUCTION BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES AND INNOVATIONS SPECIFIC TO THEIR FACILITIES. UNIVERSITY OF MASSACHUSETTS LOWELL WILL USE A VARIETY OF STRATEGIES AND METHODS TO PROMOTE AWARENESS AND ADOPTION OF POLLUTION PREVENTION SOURCE REDUCTION PRACTICES TO REDUCE TOXICS USE, WASTE GENERATION AND USE OF NATURAL RESOURCES IN BREWERIES, DAIRY PRODUCTION AND SEAFOOD PROCESSING IN MASSACHUSETTS. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE A SERIES OF INTERACTIVE WEBINARS; VIDEO-CONFERENCE CALLS; POST-WEBINAR ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES; DEVELOPMENT OF ASSISTANCE TOOLS INCLUDING SECTOR SELF-ASSESSMENTS, CHECKLISTS AND WORKSHEETS; FOLLOW-UP TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE; AND CASE STUDIES TO REDUCE USE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES, REDUCE WASTE GENERATION, AND IDENTIFY COST SAVING ACTIVITIES THAT REDUCE ENERGY AND WATER USE.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO EXPLORE THE POTENTIAL TO CREATE A POLLUTION PREVENTION CERTIFICATE PROGRAM FOR FOOD PROCESSORS AND BEVERAGE MANUFACTURERS.

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE POLLUTION PREVENTION TRAINING, OUTREACH AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THE NEW HAMPSHIRE BREWERY INDUSTRY TO REDUCE THE STRENGTH AND VOLUME OF BREWERY DISCHARGES OF WASTEWATER POLLUTANTS, IMPLEMENT ENERGY EFFICIENCY, WATER CONSERVATION AND WASTE REDUCTION PROJECTS, PROVIDE ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND OFFER TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS. THE RECIPIENT WILL PARTNER WITH NEW HAMPSHIRE ELECTRIC AND GAS UTILITIES TO PROVIDE ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE INCLUDING RECOMMENDATIONS FOR WATER AND WASTEWATER REDUCTIONS. THE RECIPIENT WILL DEVELOP LOCAL GUIDANCE DOCUMENTS AND WORK DIRECTLY WITH INDIVIDUAL BUSINESSES TO IMPLEMENT BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES FOR WASTEWATER DISCHARGES. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO IDENTIFY, DOCUMENT AND DEVELOP POLLUTION PREVENTION BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, GUIDANCE DOCUMENTS, CASE STUDIES AND VIDEOS FOR NEW HAMPSHIRE BREWERIES.

USING COMMUNITY-BASED POLLUTION PREVENTION AT THE TOWN AND REGIONAL LEVEL, THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (CTDEEP) WILL PROMOTE THE REDUCTION OF TOXIC CHEMICALS USED BY BUSINESSES, INCREASE BUSINESSES' ABILITY TO BE RESILIENT, PREVENT POLLUTION IN THE EVENT OF A NATURAL HAZARD, PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONNMENT AND HELP SAFEGUARD THE ECONOMIC VIABILITY OF BUSINESSES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. CTDEEP WILL ADD ACTIONS TO NATURAL HAZARD MITIGATION PLANS TARGETING CHEMICAL REDUCTION AND BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES; CREATE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE MATERIALS TO HELP BUSINESSES IMPROVE CHEMICAL SAFETY PRACTICES AND INCREASE RESILIENCE; AND DEVELOP AND PROMOTE ONLINE TRAINING ON THE REDUCTION OF CHEMICALS AT THE WORKPLACE.  CTDEEP WILL ALSO OFFER ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO HEALTH CARE, LODGING AND MANUFACTURING FACILITIES AND FACILITATE ROUNDTABLE MEETINGS FOR SKILLED NURSING FACILITIES.
